parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Character

1. Show me your muscle  
2. What does your muscle do for you? 
3. Can you carry all the heavy items around you with your muscles?  
4. If you wish to carry an object that is heavier than your muscle can handle, what will you have to do first?  
5. What exercises can you do to develop your muscles?
6. Will your muscles develop when you sleep all day and do nothing?
7. What would happen to you if you tried lifting a heavy object without first developing your muscles?
8. Do you know that your character is like a muscle?  
9. When you are not kind, can you share what you have with others?
10. If you wish to be kind, what will you have to do? 
11. When you are not patient, can you wait for a seed in the ground to grow up?
12. If you wish to be patient what will you have to do?
13. How do you develop your character?
14. A person who has been doing the right thing for two days, and a person who has been doing the right thing for one year, who is more righteous?
15. How do you strengthen your character?
16. What are some things that you do when helping a plant to grow or caring for a garden?
17. How does helping a plant to grow, or taking care of a garden help you to develop and strengthen your character?
18. What are some things that you do when caring for a pet?
19. How does raising a pet develop and strengthen your character?
20. How does cooking develop and strengthen your character?
21. How does repairing broken items, develop and strengthen your character?
22. How does taking instructions from your parents, and teachers, develop and strengthen your character?
23. Is the best time to develop character, when you are young, or when you are an adult?
24. What is the reason for your answer?
25. How can you tell if a person has developed their character?
26. Can you tell the character of a person by the way they look?
27. What is the reason for your answer?
28. Can a person look beautiful, yet have an ugly character?
29. What is the reason for your answer?
30. Can a person look ugly on the outside, yet beautiful on the inside?
31. What is the reason for your answer?
32. What can go wrong when you try to tell a person's character by their look?
33. What is the character of a pig?
34. When can you say that a person has the character of a pig?
35. What is the character of a dog?
36. When can you say that a person has the character of a dog?
37. What is the character of a goat?
38. When can you say that a person has the character of a goat?
39. What is the character of a sheep?
40. When can you say that a person has the character of a sheep?
41. What is the character of a chicken?
42. What is animal fear?
43. When can you say that a person has the character of a chicken?
44. What is the character of the ant?
45. When can you say that a person has the character of an ant?
46. Does God fill every man's mind with good ideas?
47. Why do most people fail to bring their ideas to life?
48. Why do many marriages fail?
49. Why do many businesses fail?
50. Why do many people who have good intentions, end up doing the opposite when the opportunity presents itself?
51. Why do many sons of God fail to live the Eternal Life?
52. Exercise:
		1. Take a plastic spoon 
		2. Fetch a spoonful of water from a bowl with the spoon 
		3. Hold it steady and walk a hundred meters away and back without losing half a spoon of the water
53. From the exercise above, describe your character.
54. From the exercise above, what can you do to develop and strengthen your character?
55. When your character has been developed, can anyone take it away from you?
56. What are some activities you can start doing to develop your character?
57. Character Activities:
	 - [ ] Split a group of young unstable individuals from stable individuals. Stable individuals learn a lesson. Stable individuals later split unstable individuals among themselves and taught them the lesson they had learned..
	 - [ ] Seal a bottle with super glue. Cut across the cover with a sharp knife, enough to slide a coin through. Save a coin in it each day. At the end of the week cut it open and give the money to a poor person around you.
	 - [ ] Each individual grows a vegetable or crop that matures within a short time, using plastic bottles with cutouts. These may include beans, okra, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc.
	 - [ ] Each individual grows a crop that takes a little longer to mature in a garden. These may include yam, corn, potatoes, etc.
	 - [ ] Each individual grows flowers in a plastic bottle with cutouts. 
	 - [ ] The group plants a garden with all kinds of crops. They surround the garden with a fence.
	 - [ ] Take instructions from your mother or father, to prepare a meal. You will not be assisted in any way, except through instructions. You will do this once a week for a month.
	 - [ ] Repair a broken item with supervision from an adult.
	 - [ ] Walk a distance without making a sound with your feet
	 - [ ] Say something nice to three people that you know each day
	 - [ ] Say something nice to a stranger each day 
	 - [ ] Mold an object with clay
	 - [ ] Say a prayer for someone other than yourself each day 
	 - [ ] Make a new friend
	 - [ ] Each day, correct someone who is doing something wrong
	 - [ ] Write a Thank You letter to your teachers
	 - [ ] Write a Thank You letter to your parents
	 - [ ] When you are sent on an errand to buy something, on your return give an account of the price of the item and the reason for the change
	 - [ ] Visit children at the hospital and pray for them, teach them to color, and help them to memorize bible verses.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Character II

1. What does it mean to have **Self Control**?
2. If you were doing your homework, and your mother told you that the food was ready, would you leave your homework to go and eat, or you will finish your homework, before going to eat?
3. If you left your homework to go and eat, do you have self-control?
4. If you finish your homework before going to eat, do you have self-control?
5. What will a person who has self-control do when:
	- He comes back home to find that the food in the house is only enough for one person, and he is in the house with his little sister.
	- He is learning in class and his friends want him to go outside and play with them.  
	- They are showing his favorite show on TV and he has homework to do.
	- He is all alone, and bad thoughts cross his mind.
6. Should we control our thoughts or let our thoughts control us?
7. In what other ways can you practice self-control?
8. What does it mean to be **Humble**?
9. How will you react When you are asked to learn how to read from a little child much younger than yourself because the child can read better than you?  
10. If you allowed yourself to be taught by the child, are you humble?
11. If you refuse to be taught by the little child, are you humble?
12. Can an adult learn something from a child without humility?  
13. When the adult refuses to be taught by the child, do they become wiser and better?
14. Do you become wiser and better, just because you are growing older?
15. Who is closer to the ground, the tall or the short person?
16. When a tall and short person is about to step into a trap, who is mostly to spot it first?
17. Why does pride come before a fall?
18. Can pride make you blind to the obvious? 
19. Can a person who has nothing, and does not know anything practice humility?  
20. Can God come to dwell amongst humans, and go through human suffering, without humility?
21. Is God humble? 
22. Should you be humble?
23. In what ways can you practice humility?
24. What does it mean to be **Respectable, Respectful**?
25. What does it mean to be respectful?  
26. How can you show respect for others?  
27. What does it mean to be respectable?  
28. What is the difference between being respectful and being respectable?  
29. What do you have to do to become respectable?  
30. Why must we be respectful?
31. Why must we be respectable?
32. What is **Dignity**?
33. When do you say that a person has dignity?
34. Will you eat food that has been served on the floor?
35. When you do, do you have dignity?
36. Will you collect money from someone when they throw it on the flow?
37. When you do, do you have dignity?
38. What do you lose in character when you wear torn or dirty clothes?
39. What do you lose in character when you wear clothes that expose your body, especially parts of your body that are meant to be private?
40. In what ways can you grow in dignity?
41. What is **Obedience**?
42. What does it mean to obey or be obedient?
43. In what ways can you be obedient to your parents?
44. In what ways can you be obedient to God?
45. Can you obey God whom you cannot see when you do not obey your parents whom you can see?
46. Can you obey God whom you cannot see when you do not obey your teachers whom you can see?
47. Can you obey God whom you cannot see when you do not obey the elders in your community, whom you can see?
48. Why must you be obedient to those who are above you and watch over you?
49. Can you learn from your teacher when you are not willing to obey them?  
50. Can your parents protect you from danger when you are not willing to obey them?
51. Can God change you and polish you when you are not willing to obey his instructions?
52. Which one is more flexible, and can easily take a new shape, water or stone?
53. When your heart is as hard as stone in obedience, can God change you into something good and beautiful?
54. Should you be as flexible as water or as hard as stone in obedience?
55. Look around you and name a few things that are wrong in your environment because of disobedience?
56. In Numbers ‪20:8–11‬, how did Moses disobey God?
> 8 “Take the staff,  and you and your brother Aaron gather the assembly together. Speak to that rock before their eyes and it will pour out its water.  You will bring water out of the rock for the community so they and their livestock can drink.”
>
> 9 So Moses took the staff from the  Lord’s presence,  just as he commanded him.  10 He and Aaron gathered the assembly together in front of the rock and Moses said to them, “Listen, you rebels, must we bring you water out of this rock?”  11 Then Moses raised his arm and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out, and the community and their livestock drank.
57. What was wrong with what Moses did?
58. What does it mean to be **Accountable**?
59. When you are sent on an errand to buy an item, on your return do you just hand over the item and the change or do you hand over the item, and give a breakdown of the cost of the item before handing over the change?
60. If you merely handed over the item and the change are you accountable?
61. If you handed over the item, and gave a breakdown of the cost before handing over the change, are you accountable?
62. Why should we be accountable?
63. If you are accountable to your parents will you be accountable to God?
64. What are some things that your parents have given to you that you will have to account for, and how?
65. What are some things that God has given to you that you will have to account for?
66. Each day when you return from school give an account of your work at school to your parents.

parts.title: The Heritage
parts.markdown:
# The Heritage

1. Read the story and recite it the way you remember it:
> I grew up in a small town with my parents, who were very successful businesspeople. When they retired, they gave me two houses, two pieces of land, and a lot of money as a gift.
> 
> Having all that money was great, but I quickly realized that if I kept
spending it carelessly, it would soon run out. Then, a new business opportunity came to town. They promised to double any money you invested in just two weeks. Many people were making a lot of money from it, and I thought this was my chance to stay rich, or even get richer.
> 
> Remembering some of the wise things I had learned, I decided to invest a small amount first to see if it really worked. To my surprise, I got back double what I had invested. Excited, I invested more money and kept getting double the return. It seemed too good to be true.
> 
> Feeling confident, I sold my houses and land and invested everything into this business. But then, I discovered it was all a scam. They were just using new investors' money to pay off the old ones, and when they had collected enough, they ran away with all the money.
> 
> Now, I'm back living with my parents, just like when I started.
2. Why did I lose all that my parents had gifted me?
3. Which character made me lose everything?
4. Which character if present in me, would have stopped me from investing in the new business?
5. Did my parents indeed bless me when they gave me all their possessions?
6. Is character a better inheritance than material things?
7. What is the reason for your answer?

parts.title: The Little Girl and Her Bike
parts.markdown:
# The Little Girl and Her Bike

1. Read the story and recite it the way you remember it:
> One sunny day, I took my bike for a ride down a hill. There was a small bump on the road meant to slow down cars.
> 
> When I hit the bump, my bike flew up! The next thing I remember is waking up in the hospital. I was surrounded by a doctor, nurses, and a familiar face. I recognized him as the man who worked at an electronics store near where I was riding my bike.
> 
> He explained what had happened. After my bike hit the bump, I fell and fainted in the middle of the road. He remembered me because I always smiled and said hi whenever I passed by. He and his friend couldn't leave me there, so they quickly stopped a taxi and took me to the hospital.
2. What could have happened to you if you were left alone in the middle of the road?
3. Why did the man rush to your rescue when you fainted?
4. Was it your character that saved you, or you were saved because of your beauty?
5. What would have happened to you if the people who saw what happened, wished to help, but hesitated because you were a rich man's child, and would be accused of trying to steal from you?
6. While you were lying in the middle of the road, was it the money in your pocket that came out of your pocket, hailed a taxi, and took you to the hospital?
7. Was it your expensive bike, clothes, or phone that saved you?
8. Was it your parents that came to your rescue?
9. Who took you to the hospital?
10. Was it your rich parent's maid or personal assistants who found you and took you to the hospital?
11. Who saved you?
12. What would have happened to you when you fainted on the road if you had been rude to the people around you, or simply pretended that they did not exist anytime you passed by?
13. How should we treat the people around us?

parts.title: The Textile Factory
parts.markdown:
# The Textile Factory

1. Read the story and recite it the way you remember it:
> I was in charge of a factory that made lots of beautiful and strong fabrics. As long as we kept making good fabrics, people kept buying them. Every morning, my driver would take me to work in my fancy car. I would pass by all the workers and cleaners, watching them from behind my tinted windows because I didn’t want to talk to them about their problems. My relationship with them was just about business.
>
>From where I sat, everything seemed perfect. The factory was running well, and our business was great. We had many checks to make sure no one took anything they weren’t supposed to. Everything going in and out of the factory was tracked, except maybe the garbage truck. At the end of the day, my driver would pick me up, and I’d watch the workers from behind my tinted windows again. But then I noticed something strange; we were making lots of fabric, but our sales and profits were going down.
>
>One sad day, I had to make a tough decision to close the factory because we ran out of money. I had already sold my car, so I had to walk out and see the disappointed faces of the workers. An old lady who worked as a cleaner came up to me, and I thought she would ask for help for her family. Instead, she took me aside and shared a secret with me.
>
>Some workers had been sneaking large amounts of our beautiful fabrics out of the factory using the garbage trucks.
2. Which character made me not want to associate with the lesser people in my factory?
3. Which character could have helped me to save the factory from closing down?
4. How would you ensure that when God lifts you, you will remain up?

>
>One sad day, I had to make a tough decision to close the factory because we ran out of money. I had already sold my car, so I had to walk out and see the disappointed faces of the workers. An old lady who worked as a cleaner came up to me, and I thought she would ask for help for her family. Instead, she took me aside and shared a secret with me.
>
>Some workers had been sneaking large amounts of our beautiful fabrics out of the factory using the garbage trucks.

sections.question: Which character made me not want to associate with the lesser people in my factory?
Which character could have helped me to save the factory from closing down?
How would you ensure that when God lifts you, you will remain up?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Compliments

1. What is a compliment?
2. What are some things that you can compliment about a person's appearance?
3. What are some things that you can compliment about a person's character?
4. What are some things that you can compliment about something that a person does?
5. How do you receive a compliment?
6. Is it a compliment if it is not honest?
7. Is it a compliment if it is not positive?
8. How will you compliment your mother?
9. Go and compliment your mother and come back.
10. How will you compliment your father?
11. Go and compliment your father and come back.
12. How will you compliment your friend? 
13. Pay a compliment to someone around you, about their appearance, character, and something that they have done.
14. How did they receive your compliment?
15. Were they happy?
16. Should we compliment others every day?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Compliments II

1. What is a compliment?
2. Why should we compliment others?
3. Draw a picture of a human body.
4. Draw a little circle on its chest.
5. Draw a straight line from the little circle out of the body and label it **friendly**.
6. Draw another little circle in the chest of the body.
7. Draw a straight line from the little circle out of the body and label it **disrespectful**.
8. Which circle do you wish to grow bigger? **friendly** circle or **disrespectful** circle?
9. How do you make the **friendly** circle grow bigger?
10. What do you have to do if you want the good in other people to grow?
11. What happens to a person when you compliment them about the good in them?
12. Will they continue to do more of the good when you compliment them about it?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Growth

1. Commit this to memory:
> Growth is not the expansion of our bodies, but rather, the expansion of our minds and personalities, over time. We must become better in our thinking, speaking, and how we behave as time passes by. That is growth. Anything that does not grow is dead.
2. When you are disrespectful today, disrespectful tomorrow, and disrespectful in the next 10 years, are you growing?
3. Does the stone change and become better as the years go by?
4. Is the stone alive?
5. Are you alive when you have become unchanging, like the stone?
6. When you are not gentle with your words, and you decide to become gentle with your words, you begin practicing your new way of speaking, and after a few years anyone who meets you is delighted to speak with you, are you growing or dying?
7. How do you make your mind expand?
8. If yesterday you did not know about growth, and now have learned about growth, has your mind expanded?
9. How do you make your personality expand?
10. If yesterday you prayed against your enemies, and today you have learned to rather pray for them, have you expanded your personality?
11. Can you say that you are neither growing nor dying?
12. Should you listen to a song that does not help you to grow?
13. Should you watch a video that does not help you to grow?
14. Should you have conversations that do not help you to grow?
15. What are some things that you can start doing now, that will help you to grow?
16. Get an exercise book and name it your "Growth Book"
	- In it, every day, write down the things that you have done or learned that have helped you to grow that day
	- At the end of each week, find out if you are growing, or dying

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Growth II

1. What are the stages of growth?
2. When you are a baby, do you know anything, or understand anything?
3. Do you know the difference between right and wrong?
4. Are you able to learn?
5. Does the spirit of the Father live in you?
6. When you grow to a stage where you now know the difference between right and wrong, good and bad, are you able to choose between right and wrong?
7. Are you able to learn?
8. Does the spirit of the Father come to live in you?
9. Do you start taking steps with God?
10. Why is every step that you take with God called a spirit victory? 
11. When you take steps with God until you become one with God, do you and the Father have the same will?
12. Do you like the things that the Father likes?
13. Do you dislike the things that the Father also dislikes?
14. Do you and God think, speak, and act alike?
15. What did Christ say about himself and the Father when he reached this stage?
16. Are you now under *grace*?
17. Will you willfully disobey the Father?
18. Do you receive anything that you ask the Father?
19. Why do you receive anything that you ask the Father?
20. When you learn from your teacher, do you set questions for yourself, answer the questions, and then tell yourself that you have passed?
21. How would you know that you and the Father have now become one?
22. Will you have any doubts that you are truly a child of the Father when the Father confirms you himself?
23. Do you want the Father to confirm you, or do you want other humans to confirm you?
24. When your spirit is mature, are you able to ascend into the Heavens without first sleeping?
25. When your spirit is mature, are you able to grow to old age because God needs you around to put the good in you into others, you sleep, and then you ascend into the Heavens
26. Which individuals were translated into Heaven without first sleeping?
27. What happens to the spirit of the Father in you, when you fail to ascend?
28. If a reason must be given on behalf of each individual who fails to ascend, why they failed to ascend, should we do what we can to help each other to grow, or rather, discourage them?
29. What are some things that you can do to help other people to grow, and be able to ascend?
30. Which stage are you in now?
31. How do you get to the next stage?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# I Am a Little Seed

1. What is a seed?
2. Does a mango seed look like a mango tree?
3. Does the mango tree come from the mango seed?
4. When God wants to start something big, does he start small or does he start big?
5. When you find a mango seed, and you throw it away, what have you actually thrown away?
6. What do you do to make a seed grow?
7. What do you do about the weeds?
8. Do you know that you are a seed?
9. What do you have to do to grow?
10. If you are the seed, then who are the weeds?
11. What do you do about the people who try to prevent you from growing?
12. When a seed has grown into a mighty tree, what can we get from the tree?
13. When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you become medicine to other people?
14. When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you bear fruits?
15.  When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you become a shelter for others?
16. When you have grown into a mighty person, how can you offer shade to others?
17. When you have grown up yet you are not a medicine to anyone, you do not bear fruits, and you are also not a shelter for anyone, are you a mighty person?
18. The tree and the seed, which one is easier to destroy?
19. Can you easily be destroyed when you are little or when you are an adult?
20. What are some things that can destroy you, and prevent you from growing into a mighty person?
21. How do you protect yourself from getting destroyed?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# I Am a Little Seed II

1. In **Mathew 5:48**, who is speaking?
> 48 You must be perfect—just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
2. Who is God speaking to?
3. What does God expect from every man?
4. Is it possible to become perfect?
5. Is it possible to become like God?
6. What does it mean to be perfect?
7. Are you perfect when you are not respectful?
8. Are you perfect when you are not kind?
9. If you wish to become like someone, what do you have to do?
10. How does a man become perfect like God?
11. Read **Psalm 82** twice
> 1 God presides in the great assembly;  
he renders judgment  among the “gods”:
>
> 2 “How long will you defend the unjust and show partiality to the wicked? 
> 3 Defend the weak and the fatherless;  uphold the cause of the poor and the oppressed.   
> 4 Rescue the weak and the needy;   deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
> 
> 5 “The ‘gods’ know nothing, they understand nothing. They walk about in darkness;   all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
> 
> 6 “I said, ‘You are “gods”;   you are all sons of the Most High.’   
> 7 But you will die  like mere mortals;   you will fall like every other ruler.”
> 
> 8 Rise up,  O God, judge the earth,   for all the nations are your inheritance.
12. What is judgment?
13. Which people have gathered?
14. Who is leading the gathering?
15. In verse 2, what are the gods doing wrong?
16. What does God expect from the gods in verse 3?
17. What does God expect from the gods in verse 4?
18. Who is the Most High in verse 6?
19. Why does God have to remind the gods that "I said, ‘You are “gods”; you are all sons of the Most High?"
20. Read  **John 10:30-36**
> 30 I and the Father are one.”
> 
> 31 Again his Jewish opponents picked up stones to stone him,  32 but Jesus said to them,  “I have shown you many good works from the Father. For which of these do you stone me?”
> 
> 33 “We are not stoning you for any good work,” they replied, “but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God.”
> 
> 34 Jesus answered them,  “Is it not written in your Law,  ‘I have said you are “gods”’?  35 If he called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came—and Scripture cannot be set aside—  36 what about the one whom the Father set apart as his very own and sent into the world?  Why then do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?
21. In verse 33, why did the Jews try to stone Jesus?
22. What is blasphemy?
23. In verse 34, which part of the bible was Jesus referring to?
24. In verse 35, who are the gods?
25. Read  Psalm 82 again
26. In verse 5, Why does God say that "The ‘gods’ know nothing, they understand nothing...?"
27. Do the gods know that they are gods?
28. Do the gods know that they are all sons of the Most High, and can become like God?
29. What happens to you when you walk in a place without light?
30. When do we say that a person is living in darkness?
31. In verse 5, why does God say that the gods walk about in darkness?
32. Is the earth a school?
33. What is the purpose of a school?
34. What are the gods supposed to learn before they leave the earth?
35. When a person walks into a school and comes out worse than they entered it, is the school serving its purpose?
36. When all the people who walk into a school, come out worse than they entered it, and bad has now become good, is the school serving its purpose?
37. Why does God say that the earth has gone out of course?
38. Even though men are children of the Most High, what will happen to them if they do not conduct themselves like sons of God?
39. Did the Jews understand Psalm 82 at the time of Jesus?
40. Do the people around you know and understand Psalm 82?
41. What are you going to do about it?
42. Read **Numbers 18:20**
>  20 The Lord said to Aaron, “You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any share among them; I am your share and your inheritance among the Israelites.
43. *The children of Israel had settled down and divided the lands among themselves. Aaron asks God what his share will be and God tells him that He, God, will be his share and inheritance.*
44. How does God become your share and your portion?
45. When you become like God, can you also do the things that God can do?
46. Do you want God or the things that God has created?
47. How do you inherit someone?
48. How do you inherit God, who will not die?
49. Who received the greatest gift among the children of Israel?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Christ in a Nutshell

To understand Christ better you need to understand the Trinity. John puts it best. John 1

In the Old Testament, we only knew God, but it turns out that multiple spirit personalities are also God, Christ is one of them, and he also happens to be the creator of the world and all that is in it.

God does not exist, God is, and he brings beings into existence. Christ has always been, before his incarnation on earth and this baffled a lot of people who thought that they knew all about his birth and lineage. John 8:48-59

Christ did not want the people of his day to know who he was by his testimony, but to figure it out for themselves by his works and their understanding of scriptures.

Christ had the power to forgive sins and had been forgiving sins long before his crucifixion. Luke 5:24

The whole idea of atonement is a misplaced attempt at making sense of his gruesome death on the cross. Even so, He would not suffer the Jews to weep for him as he was about to be crucified, because he knew what was about to happen to them after his death and resurrection would be worse than death by the cross. Luke 23:27-28

Christ before his death on the cross said many hard sayings which were hard for the people of his day to accept: John 11:20-26. He is not only capable of resurrecting you, but he is the resurrection. That means that when you have become like Christ, by imitating Christ through the ministry of the Holy Spirit, you become like an inflated balloon which when placed on water, will never sink, and when pushed to the bottom of the water and released will quickly float to the surface. You will never die; when you get killed, you shall rise again.

Many people thought that Christ had demons, and called him a Samaritan, a madman, etc. They did not take his message seriously. He knew that for the people to believe him he would have to give them a sign. Matthew 12:38-42

So when the time came for him to be crucified, his enemies including the devil thought that they had the opportunity to humiliate him by his death on the cross. What they did not know was that the Father had plans to use that as an opportunity to glorify the Son and make the message of Christ take root in the hearts of men. Stay with me here.

If Christ had not died a public death his resurrection would not have meant much to anyone. By his public humiliation, death on the cross, burial, and resurrection on the third day, it became apparent to everyone that Christ, the carpenter's son, was not out of his mind after all and that all that he had been saying was the truth. You can imagine what this did in the camp of the devil and all believers who had been sitting on the fence about his teachings the whole time. This was what made the message of Christ start spreading and taking root in the hearts of men to the point where they were willing to die for it. You can see that after his resurrection even his disciples did not believe it despite walking with Christ the whole time so he had to show them proof by showing them the marks on his palm.

Christ is the key to the Father's house. He is the way, the truth, and the life. Become like Christ and you will live. Through him, more men must become like Christ, and then they will be able to ascend, and the Holy Spirit is here to assist with that. The Christian life cannot be lived without the Holy Spirit. To be like Christ is to have Christ. I cannot stress this enough. To believe the Son of God is to act on his every word, and not merely profess it, for by doing man becomes.

Narrow is the way. This is because many will devise their means to enter God's kingdom which does not require them to change anything about themselves.

Matthew 5:48. The only way to become like God is to imitate God. There is no other way. Christ has been given to us as our role model, and criteria, and not only that; after taking on human nature is now able to help humans overcome their human limitations and be able to meet the Father's mark of perfection.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Eternal Life in a Nutshell

Matthew 5:48
> 48 You must be perfect—just as your Father in heaven is perfect.

- To be perfect is to be like God
- God expects all his children to become perfect, so perfection is possible
- Humans cannot make you perfect
- Your Pastor cannot make you perfect
- Your Evangelist, Prophet, Teachers, Apostle, Parents, Angels, etc do not have what it takes to make perfect
- Following the laws only makes you human, not perfect
- They are to bring you to the point where you are *human* and help you establish a *living* fellowship with the Father
- To be perfect, man has to walk with God
- It is personal, not social
- Only God can make a man perfect, and that is why God has placed his Spirit in you, it is by taking steps with God directly, that one obtains Eternal Life
- Eternal life is God's way of life

John 17:3
> 3 Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

Matthew 19:16-22

> 16 Now behold, one came and said to Him, “Good Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?”
>
> 17 So He said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one _is_ good but One, _that is,_ God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
>
> 18 He said to Him, “Which ones?”
>
> Jesus said, “‘You shall not murder,’ ‘You shall not commit adultery,’ ‘You shall not steal,’ ‘You shall not bear false witness,’ 19 ‘Honor your father and _your_ mother,’ and, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ ”
>
> 20 The young man said to Him, “All these things I have kept from my youth. What do I still lack?”
>
> 21 Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
>
> 22 But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.

The rich young ruler must follow three steps:
- Follow all the commandments
- Give all that he has to the poor
- Follow Christ (for it is by following and imitating God that a man becomes like God)

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# God's Judgement

1. What is judgment?
2. What is Evil?
3. When you do the wrong thing without knowing that it is wrong, have you committed Evil?
4. What is God's judgement for Evil?
5. Give examples of Evil
6. What is Sin?
7. When you do the wrong thing knowing very well that it is wrong, have you committed Sin?
8. What is God's judgement for Sin?
9. Give examples of Sin.
10. What is the difference between Sin and Evil?
11. Can something that is Evil for one person, become a Sin for another? 
12. What is the reason for your answer, and give examples?
13. What is Iniquity?
14. When you do the wrong thing knowing that it is wrong, and continue to do it even after you have been prompted by other people, are you committing Eniquity?
15. What is God's judgement for Iniquity?
16. Give examples of Iniquity
17. What is the difference between Sin and Iniquity?
18. What is Righteousness?
19. What is God's judgement for Righteousness?
20. Give examples of Righteousness
21. What is the right way to sweep your house?
22. What is the right way to produce children?
23. What is the right way to respond to a person who has offended you?
24. Why is Righteousness God's food for his children?
25. Who is a Righteous Man?
26. In Matthew 6:33, how do you seek God's Righteousness daily?
>But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
27. Is Righteousness the same as repentance?
28. What is the difference between Righteousness and repentance?
29. Is Righteousness something that you do or something that you do not do?
30. Is repentance something that you do or something that you do not do?
31. What is the cure for Evil?
32. In what ways did Christ fight and uproot Evil?
33. What is the cure for Sin?
34. In Matthew 23:11, why does the righteousness of God require that to become the greatest, you must first be the least?
>The greatest among you must be a servant.
35. In Matthew 6:11, what did Jesus mean by our daily bread, and how do we eat it?
 >Give us today our daily bread.
36. In John 4:30-32, what is Jesus' special food, and how does he eat it?
>30 They came out of the town and made their way toward him.
>31 Meanwhile his disciples urged him, “Rabbi,  eat something.”
>32 But he said to them,  “I have food to eat  that you know nothing about.”
37. In Luke 23:34 why does Jesus ask God to forgive them?
> Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.
38. Did they commit Sin or Evil?
39. When Adam and Eve ate from the forbidden tree, did they commit Sin or Evil?
40. What is the reason for your answer?
41. In Genesis 4:3-7, what is the story?
> 3 In the course of time Cain brought some of the fruits of the soil as an offering to the  Lord.  4 And Abel also brought an offering—fat portions from some of the firstborn of his flock.  The  Lord looked with favor on Abel and his offering,  5 but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor. So Cain was very angry, and his face was downcast.
> 
> 6 Then the  Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry?  Why is your face downcast?  7 If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door;  it desires to have you, but you must rule over it.”
42. In verse 7, where is Sin?
43. What is the posture of Sin?
44. Are you born with Sin?
45. Do you choose to Sin?
46. What will Sin do to you when you let it in through the door?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Man's Judgement

1. What is judgment?
2. What is evil?
3. What is the cure for evil?
4. What is sin?
5. What is the cure for sin?
6. Where does God's judgment take place?
7. How does God's judgment (Evil, Sin, Iniquity, Righteousness) affect the leaves in the *mind tree* and the *heart tree*?
8. Has the sinner already paid for their sin?
9. In Matthew 19:21, has the righteous already received the reward of their righteousness?
>Jesus answered, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
10. When a person sins or commits evil and God has already judged them, is there a need for other humans to also judge them again, or rather, cure them?
11. When a person does something wrong and is later found to have committed evil, what does God expect other humans to do? 
12. When a person does something wrong and is later found to have sinned, what does God expect other humans to do?
13. Would the person commit evil had they been taught?
14. How can you cure a person of evil?
15. Would the person sin had they practiced God's righteousness until it had become part of them?
16. How can you cure a person of sin?
17. When a person *intentionally* destroys other people's things, do they commit sin or evil?
18. What can you do to cure such a person?
19. When a person steals, do they commit sin or evil?
20. What can you do to cure such a person?
21. When a person wishes to stop insulting but ends up insulting other people anyway, do they commit sin or evil?
22. What can you do to cure such a person?
23. A man sets a trap for an animal in the forest and ends up trapping the leg of an old woman who is almost blind. The old woman eventually dies. Did the man commit sin or evil?
24. What can you do to cure such a person?
25. When the man goes to set a trap there again knowing very well that other humans might be passing there, and he traps the leg of a human, did he commit sin or evil?
26. What can you do to cure such a person?
27. Your friend informs you that her mother beats her in the house every day. You go to her house to talk to the mother with the hope that her mother might stop beating her. Her mother rather gets angry and starts beating her even more. Did you commit sin or evil?
28. What might be a possible cure to prevent you from making the same mistake again?
29. A man wants to build a house. He first has to clear the land so he cuts down a few trees that are growing on the land. After building the house he falls sick and prays to God. God tells him that the medicine that will cure his sickness can only be found in the tree that he had cut whiles building his house. Did the man commit sin or evil?
30. What can be done to cure him so he does not make the same mistake again?
31. Give other examples of evil, sin, and iniquity, and how they can be cured

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe

1. What do you observe in Matthew 12:22-29?

> 22 Then they brought him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute, and Jesus healed him, so that he could both talk and see.  23 All the people were astonished and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”
> 
> 24 But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, “It is only by Beelzebul,  the prince of demons, that this fellow drives out demons.”
> 
> 25 Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them,  “Every kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.  26 If Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then can his kingdom stand?  27 And if I drive out demons by Beelzebul,  by whom do your people drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.  28 But if it is by the Spirit of God that I drive out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
> 
> 29 “Or again, how can anyone enter a strong man’s house and carry off his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man? Then he can plunder his house.
2. In verse 22, what was the man suffering from because he had demons living in him?
3. Can demons make a man blind and mute?
4. What happened to the man after the demons had left him?
5. In verse 24, who do the Pharisees claim to be possessed by Beelzebub?
6. Who is Beelzebub?
7. Does Satan have a kingdom?
8. Is Beelzebub in Satan's kingdom?
9. In Luke 13:10-16, who held the woman bound?
> 10 On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,  11 and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.  12 When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her,  “Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.”  13 Then he put his hands on her,  and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
> 
> 14 Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath,  the synagogue leader said to the people, “There are six days for work.  So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath.”
> 
> 15 The Lord answered him,  “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you on the Sabbath untie your ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?  16 Then should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham,  whom Satan  has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?”
10. Is Satan's kingdom organized, or divided against itself?
11. Does Jesus drive out demons because he is possessed by the prince of demons?
12. In verse 28, by what means does Jesus drive out demons?
13. Who brought about the driving out of demons?
14. Who exposed Satan's kingdom, which had been hidden from men because it was invisible?
15. In verse 29, who is the strongman?
16. What is the strongman's house?
17. Why does Jesus drive out demons?
18. Can you do the will of God when you have demons?
19. Can you serve God well when you have demons?
20. Can you successfully teach the word of God to other people when they have demons?
21. Why did Christ drive out demons everywhere he went? Mark 1:34, Mark 1:39
>Mark 1:34
>And He healed many who were ill with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He was not permitting the demons to speak, because they knew who He was.
>
> Mark 1:39
> So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
22. Who is your foe?
23. How many kingdoms exist?
24. Can you belong in both kingdoms at the same time?
25. Describe fashion in both kingdoms.
26. Describe marriage in both kingdoms.
27. Describe sex in both kingdoms.
28. Describe music in both kingdoms.
29. Which animal best describes the kingdom of darkness?
30. Which animal best describes the kingdom of light?
31. Which kingdom do you belong to?
32. What is the reason for your answer?
33. Write down 5 ways the kingdom of light differs from the kingdom of darkness.
34. Can the believer be afflicted by demons? 
35. In what ways does a person get afflicted by demons? John 5:14
> 14 Afterward, Jesus found him in the Temple and said, “Listen, you are well now; so stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”
36. Can you be afflicted by demons because of unforgiveness?
37. When you do not forgive others are you holding them prisoners?
38. When you do not release others because of unforgiveness, will God also forgive you and release you?
39. Can you be afflicted by demons because of a generational spirit in your bloodline?
40. Can you be afflicted by demons because of a trauma you experienced while you were a child?
41. Pray to God and confess all your sins. 
42. Forgive everyone you have not forgiven and ask God to forgive you.

How then can his kingdom stand?  27 And if I drive out demons by Beelzebul,  by whom do your people drive them out? parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe II

1. What do you observe in Luke 11:14?
> Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.
2. Was the demon mute?
3. Was the man also mute?
4. When the demon left the man, could he speak?
5. What caused the man to be mute?
6. In Luke 13:10-13, what caused the woman to be bent over?
>10 On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,  11 and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years.  She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.  12 When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her,  “Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.”  13 Then he put his hands on her,  and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
7. What happened to the woman when the demon was sacked?
8. How long did it take for the woman to straighten up?
9. Can the presence of a demon in a person make them develop a problem?
10. Can the presence of a demon in a person make them develop the same problem that the demon has?
11. What other problems can a person develop due to the presence of a demon in them?
12. Is your foe visible or invisible?
13. How does this make it difficult for humans to deal with them?
14. When a demon is present in you, do they rule over you and make you do things that you don't want to do, or rather, allow you to rule over them?
15. Can you control your anger, when a demon of anger lives in you?
16. Can you stop lusting when a demon of lust lives in you?
17. Can you speak good words when a vulgar spirit lives in you?
18. Can you break your addiction to smoking, alcohol, etc. when a demon of addiction is the strongman of your body?
19. In what ways do demons show their presence in a human?
20. Can a demon give you **addictions**?
21. What are some addictions that you can have?
22. Can a demon give you **sickness**?
23. What are some sicknesses that can be caused by demons?
24. Can a sickness that is caused by a demon be treated using traditional medicine? 
25. Can a demon give you  **bad habits**?
26. What are some bad habits that you wish to stop but you always keep going back to them?
27. Can demons fill your mind with **dirty, profane, suicidal thoughts**?
28. Can demons remind you about things that you have done in the past to make you feel **guilty** and draw you away from God?
29. Are all thoughts in your head yours?
30. How do you deal with a sickness, addiction, or bad habit that is caused by a demon?
31. Should you ignore thoughts that the enemy tries to put in your head?
32. How do you deal with thoughts from the enemy?
33. In Mark 5:1-20, what is the story of the demon-possessed man?
34. Where was the man living because of the unclean spirits in him?
35. What did he do to himself because of the unclean spirits?
36. Where does he get the strength to destroy the chains that are used to bind him?
37. In verses 6-7, can unclean spirits talk?
38. In verse 8, how did Jesus drive out the demon?
39. In verse 7, what happened to the demons when Jesus asked them to come out of the man?
40. Do unclean spirits have feelings and emotions and feel pain?
41. In verses 11-13, can unclean spirits go into animals?
42. In verse 13, how did the unclean spirits going into the pigs affect the pigs?
43. In Matthew 16:21-23, what is the story?
> 21 From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem  and suffer many things  at the hands of the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law,  and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.
> 
> 22 Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!”
> 
> 23 Jesus turned and said to Peter,  “Get behind me, Satan!  You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”
44. What is a rebuke?
45. Who took Jesus aside to rebuke him?
46. Who did Jesus rebuke in return?
47. Who was truly talking to Jesus, Peter or Satan?
48. Is every person who speaks to you, actually the one speaking?
49. How would you know that the person speaking with you is truly the person speaking with you, or some evil spirit?
50. In 1 John 4:1-3, How can you tell if a person speaking to you is speaking by an evil spirit?
> 4 My dear friends, do not believe all who claim to have the Spirit, but test them to find out if the spirit they have comes from God. For many false prophets have gone out everywhere. 2 This is how you will be able to know whether it is God's Spirit: anyone who acknowledges that Jesus Christ came as a human being has the Spirit who comes from God. 3 But anyone who denies this about Jesus does not have the Spirit from God. The spirit that he has is from the Enemy of Christ; you heard that it would come, and now it is here in the world already.
51. Pray and ask God to give you the spirit of discernment to be able to tell the difference between spirits.

sections.body: > 4 My dear friends, do not believe all who claim to have the Spirit, but test them to find out if the spirit they have comes from God. For many false prophets have gone out everywhere. 2 This is how you will be able to know whether it is God's Spirit: anyone who acknowledges that Jesus Christ came as a human being has the Spirit who comes from God. 3 But anyone who denies this about Jesus does not have the Spirit from God. The spirit that he has is from the Enemy of Christ; you heard that it would come, and now it is here in the world already.

sections.question: Pray and ask God to give you the spirit of discernment to be able to tell the difference between spirits.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe III

1. In 16:17-18, what signs shall follow the believer?
> 17 And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;
> 
> 18 They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.
2. What does it mean to believe?
3. What authority has Jesus given to the believer?
4. Does the believer exercise his authority in the name of Jesus or the blood of Jesus?
5. Does the believer have the authority to force out demons?
6. Does the believer have the authority to heal normal sicknesses that are not caused by demons?
7. How did Jesus force out demons? Mark 5:8
>8 For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of this man, you impure spirit!”
8. How do you force a demon out of a person?
9. Repeat 10 times
> Every unclean spirit, come out in Jesus' name
10. How did Christ heal normal sicknesses not caused by demons? Luke 4:38-40
>38 Jesus left the synagogue and went to Simon's home. Simon's mother-in-law was sick with a high fever, and they spoke to Jesus about her. 39 He went and stood at her bedside and ordered the fever to leave her. The fever left her, and she got up at once and began to wait on them.
>40 After sunset all who had friends who were sick with various diseases brought them to Jesus; he placed his hands on every one of them and healed them all.
11. How do you heal a person who is suffering from a sickness not caused by a demon?
12. Lay your hand on another person and repeat 10 times
> Sickness, leave now in the name of Jesus
13. Before teaching the word of God to people, should you first sack every unclean spirit out of them?
14. Deliver yourself from every unclean spirit
> I am free from every unclean spirit in the name of Jesus
15. Deliver yourself from every curse
> Lord Jesus, deliver me from every curse and power of the enemy
16. When forcing out an unclean spirit is proving difficult what else can you do? Mark 5:9
>9 Then Jesus asked him,  “What is your name?” “My name is Legion,”  he replied, “for we are many.”
17. Can you force out a demon by first asking their name, and then referring to them by name to come out in the name of Jesus?
18. How do you make sure that the demon does not enter the person again? Mark 9:25
> 25 When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit. “You deaf and mute spirit,” he said, “I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”
19. What do you do with thoughts that the devil tries to put in your head? James 4:7
> Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
20. How do you resist the devil in your thoughts?
21. Should you silently ignore these thoughts?
22. Should you vocally rebuke these thoughts and command them to leave you in the name of Jesus?
23. Repeat three(3) times:
> Let every unclean thought depart from me in the name of Jesus
24. Should you watch what you see with your eyes if you do not want to be troubled by evil spirits?
25. What is the reason for your answer?
26. Should you watch what you hear with your ears if you do not want to be troubled by evil spirits?
27. What is the reason for your answer?
28. Should you watch what you say with your tongue if you do not want to be troubled by evil spirits?
29. What is the reason for your answer?
30. Should you watch what you do with your body if you do not want to have trouble with evil spirits?
31. What is the reason for your answer?
32. Should you watch what you bring into your home if you do not want to have trouble with evil spirits? Deuteronomy 7:26
> Make sure you set fire to their carved gods. Don’t get greedy for the veneer of silver and gold on them and take it for yourselves—you’ll get trapped by it for sure. GOD hates it; it’s an abomination to GOD, your God. And don’t dare bring one of these abominations home or you’ll end up just like it, burned up as a holy destruction. No: It is forbidden! Hate it. Abominate it. Destroy it and preserve GOD’s holiness.
33. What is the reason for your answer?
34. Should you have discussions with evil spirits?
35. Should you entertain evil spirits?
36. Should you be afraid of evil spirits?
37. What do you do when you come across an evil spirit?
38. Are you prepared for warfare?

parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe IV

1. How did the giants of old come into existence? Genesis 6:1-8
> 6 When people had spread all over the world, and daughters were being born, 2 some of the heavenly beings saw that these young women were beautiful, so they took the ones they liked. 3 Then the  Lord said, “I will not allow people to live forever; they are mortal. From now on they will live no longer than 120 years.” 4 In those days, and even later, there were giants on the earth who were descendants of human women and the heavenly beings. They were the great heroes and famous men of long ago.
> 
> 5 When the  Lord saw how wicked everyone on earth was and how evil their thoughts were all the time, 6 he was sorry that he had ever made them and put them on the earth. He was so filled with regret 7 that he said, “I will wipe out these people I have created, and also the animals and the birds, because I am sorry that I made any of them.” 8 But the  Lord was pleased with Noah.
2. Did the heavenly beings defile themselves by having children with both humans and animals, giving birth to all kinds of abominable creatures such as giants, mermaids, etc?
3. Did humans worship these heavenly beings and their children as gods?
4. Who taught humans how to abort babies in the womb?
5. Who taught women how to paint their faces and use charms? 2 Kings 9:30
> When Jezebel, the queen mother, heard that Jehu had come to Jezreel, she painted her eyelids and fixed her hair and sat at a window.
6. Who taught humans how to fight wars?
7. How did God get rid of the giants?
8. How did God deal with their parents, the heavenly beings?
9. What spirits came out of these giants after the flood had destroyed their bodies in the days of Noah?
10. Do evil spirits die?
11. Do evil spirits have names and behave like people with personalities?
12. Do they thirst and hunger yet eat no food or drink water?
13. When will evil spirits be completely wiped out from the earth?
14. Until the great judgment, will evil spirits continue to fight the children of God?
15. Was hell made for these fallen spirits and their children or humans? Matthew 25:41
>41 “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
16. Do evil spirits work with the devil to fight the children of God?
17. Who is the head of the family of evil spirits? Matthew 10:23-26
> 23 When you are persecuted in one place, flee to another. Truly I tell you, you will not finish going through the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
> 
> 24 “The student is not above the teacher, nor a servant above his master.  25 It is enough for students to be like their teachers, and servants like their masters. If the head of the house has been called Beelzebul,  how much more the members of his household!
> 
> 26 “So do not be afraid of them, for there is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.
18. What is the meaning of the name Beelzebul?
> chief spirit of evil and adversary of God; tempter of mankind; master of Hell.
19. Will you be tempted by evil spirits?
20. Will you be persecuted by humans under the influence of evil spirits?
21. Should you be afraid of the kingdom of darkness?
22. Pray to God to deliver you from every temptation.

parts.title: V
parts.markdown:
# Know Your Foe V

1. Did Christ make much effort in exposing the kingdom of darkness?
2. Name instances where Christ exposes the nature of the kingdom of darkness
3. Should the follower of Christ also attempt to expose the kingdom of darkness, ignore it, or pretend it does not exist?
4. Was the Devil hidden from humans for the most part of the Old Testament?
5. Were many incidents in the Old Testament attributed to God, because God was all the Israelites knew? 2 Samuel 24:1, 1 Chronicles 21:1
> 2 Samuel 24:1
> Again the anger of the Lord burned against Israel, and he incited David against them, saying, “Go and take a census of Israel and Judah.”
>
>1 Chronicles 21:1
> Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
6. Give other examples of evil being attributed to God in the Old Testament.
7. Is Christ the most accurate representation of the Character of the Father?
8. What is the reason for your answer?
9. If the person ruling a country has a demon, who is ruling the country?
10. Why should you pray for the people in authority?
11. Pray for the people in authority where you live
12. In Ezekiel 28:1-10, is God speaking to a man, or superhuman?
13. Who is the man in Tyre?
14. In verse 5, what did the man do wrong?
15. Why is the man filled with Pride? 
16. When do you say that a person has Pride?
17. Can pride make you blind to the obvious?
18. In what ways does Pride make you blind to the obvious?
19. In Ezekiel 28:11-19, is God speaking to a man, or superhuman?
20. Who is the person in Tyre?
21. In verse 17, what did the person do wrong?
22. Why is the person filled with Pride?
23. Is the ruler of Tyre and the King of Tyre the same person?
24. Who is the ruler of Tyre, and who is the King of Tyre?
25. In verse 13, is the King of Tyre a created being?
26. In verse 14, what was the King of Tyre created to do?
27. Why does God state that the King of Tyre is a created being, and even describe how he was created?
28. What does it mean to trade in something?
29. In verse 16, what was the King of Tyre trading in?
30. Was the King of Tyre perfect in beauty?
31. Was the King of Tyre full of Wisdom?
32. Was the King of Tyre's wisdom corrupted?
33. How did the King of Tyre corrupt his wisdom?
34. Pray to God to take every form of pride away from you.
35. Who was the first rebel?
36. Who is the ruler of all rebels?
37. Do the people who worship God know who they worship?
38. Do the people who worship the devil know who they worship?
39. In what ways do people indirectly worship the devil or do as he does?
40. What is witchcraft?
41. If a person attempts to control another person with the help of an evil spirit, is the person practicing witchcraft?
42. In what ways do people practice witchcraft where you live?
43. What is divination?
44. If a person tries to obtain knowledge with the help of an evil spirit, is the person practicing divination?
45. In what ways do people practice divination where you live
46. What is sorcery?
47. If a person uses an object, music or a drug to transmit demonic power is the person practicing sorcery?
48. Give examples of how people practice sorcery where you live
49. When you lose control of yourself can evil spirits easily come in?
50. Why is alcohol called spirits?
51. Does God want you to have self-control or not?
52. Is anything that makes you lose your self-control ungodly?
53. Does the Kingdom of Darkness attempt to produce its version of every marvelous thing God does?
54. Give examples of attempts by the Kingdom of Darkness to produce its version of things that God has done.
55. Does the Kingdom of Darkness have a Christ called the Anti-Christ?
56. Does the Kingdom of Darkness have Apostles?
57. Does the Kingdom of Darkness have teachers?
58. Does the Kingdom of Darkness know how to twist the truth to cause humans to fall?
59. Give examples of how the Kingdom of Darkness twists the truth to cause humans to fall.

parts.title: Breaking Addictions
parts.markdown:
# Breaking Addictions

This is how the devil has held many children of God in bondage: the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life.

There is a point in addiction where a demon gets involved. They attach themselves to the individual, bind them and nothing they do can set them free. They are stuck in a cycle of defeat. You will hate what you do each time you do it because there is a pure spirit in you reacting to the bad that you have introduced into your system, but after repenting, you will return to doing it again. Christ calls this demon the strongman.

Mark 3:27

> In fact, no one can enter a strong man’s house without first tying him up. Then  he can plunder the strong man’s house.

  Fortunately, Christ has given the believer authority over the powers of darkness (yes, they do have power).

Luke 10:19 
> I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you.

Mark 16:17-18

> 17 And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;
> 
> 18 They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

The believer, not God, shall cast out devils. Force the demon out in the name of Jesus. Mark 16:17, Mark 5:8, Mark 9:25 Command the spirit of pornography, [insert sin] to leave you in the name of Jesus and never return.

After this give your heart, mind, and body to God. Tell God "Heavenly Father, I give you my heart, I give you my mind, I give you my body and soul in the name of Jesus." Let this be your daily consecration.

parts.title: Distraction - A Neat Trick of the Devil
parts.markdown:
# Distraction - A Neat Trick of the Devil

Imagine a thief wanting to steal from you in broad daylight. First, they create a distraction because as long as you're paying attention, they can't take anything. They might notice where you keep your money. If it's in your left pocket, they might tap you on your right shoulder and then sneak their hand into your left pocket to steal your money without you noticing.

Think about a hen. She's usually calm and harmless, but if you try to take one of her chicks or get too close, she'll defend them fiercely. So, if you wanted to steal one of her chicks without a fight, you'd need a distraction.

When you're focused on a goal, sometimes you don't notice other important things slipping away. It's like a trick to keep you distracted from what truly matters.

In the past, a husband and wife would agree on who does what at home. The husband would go to work and earn money, while the wife took care of the house and kids. This way, the kids were always looked after, and any bad behavior was quickly noticed and corrected. The parents could guide their kids' upbringing.

But then, the wife might hear a little voice saying, "You're being cheated! You can make as much money as your husband. You're wasting your life at home while he gets to have a career. What if something happens to him? How will you take care of the kids?"

So, the wife gets a job and hands over her responsibilities to someone else. While she's busy working, guess who's left vulnerable? The kids, and the one who comes to take advantage of this is the devil.

When couples start fighting, it's often because the devil is trying to distract them so he can influence their kids. He's not interested in the husband or wife; his target is the children.

If a husband suddenly finds other women showing interest in him, he shouldn't think it's because he's become more attractive. Let the husband know that when a snake holds his gaze at a frog, it is not because the frog is handsome or pretty, the snake is just being a snake and frogs are what they eat. It's just a distraction to ruin his family. I asked a young wife who was spying on her husband to gather evidence of cheating: while she was doing that, who was looking after her kids? When she got back, would her kids still be the same?

Think about the hen and her chicks. As long as she's alert, no one can steal her chicks. But if she gets distracted, what then?

parts.title: Forbidden Knowledge - A Neat Trick of the Devil
parts.markdown:
# Forbidden Knowledge - A Neat Trick of the Devil

The devil used to be in heaven, so he knows a lot. And people are curious. Wouldn't it be cool to know how angels live in heaven, how they show up on Earth, or how to make them do stuff for you? What about talking to your dead mom? This curiosity makes some people join cults to learn secret things and try to get an edge over others.

But here's the catch: the leader of these cults is in chains, and the same thing happens to anyone who climbs the ranks. Knowledge without wisdom can mess you up.

In Revelation 2:24, it says:

> 24 “But the rest of you in Thyatira have not followed this evil teaching; you have not learned what the others call ‘the deep secrets of Satan.’ I say to you that I will not put any other burden on you.

Occult books never use the real names of demons because of Christ. Instead, they use names from the Bible or call them saints. People who read these books often end up messed up. Let God's spirit help you decide what to read and what to avoid.

Remember the Garden of Eden? The devil tricked Adam and Eve with knowledge: Genesis 3:11

> And he said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”

Movies often make witchcraft look cool, but it only leads to destruction.

The devil is really good at taking the truth and twisting it to lead you astray.

parts.title: Impersonation - A Neat Trick of the Devil
parts.markdown:
# Impersonation - A Neat Trick of the Devil

Jesus says he has to go to Jerusalem and die. Peter, his friend, tells him that it won't happen. Many people thought Peter was just being Peter, but Jesus knows better and rebukes someone else. Check out Matthew 16:21-23:

> 21 From that time on, Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, the chief priests, and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life. 22 Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!” 23 Jesus turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”

Satan can pretend to be humans and use them to trick others. You might think it’s your friend, teacher, or even your parent talking to you, but it could be the devil or one of his demons speaking through them.

For example, if a friend suggests you try drugs, or someone tells you you're too uptight and should loosen up, it might be the devil using them. Satan even tried to use Peter, one of Jesus' closest friends, but Jesus saw through it and spoke to Satan, not Peter. Imagine how tricky it was for people before Jesus came and revealed these deceptions.

1 John 4:1-3 helps you figure out if someone is speaking by God's spirit or an evil spirit:

> 4 My dear friends, do not believe all who claim to have the Spirit, but test them to find out if the spirit they have comes from God. For many false prophets have gone out everywhere. 2 This is how you will be able to know whether it is God's Spirit: anyone who acknowledges that Jesus Christ came as a human being has the Spirit who comes from God. 3 But anyone who denies this about Jesus does not have the Spirit from God. The spirit that he has is from the Enemy of Christ; you heard that it would come, and now it is here in the world already.

Imagine if the leader of your country was being tricked by Satan, which has happened before. Look at 1 Corinthians 2:8:

> None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

Evil spirits can fill your mind with thoughts that seem like your own, and they can make you think God is talking to you when it’s really them.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Biology of Love
Interpretation

1. **Different people interpret the same thing differently:** There are many ways that individuals interpret the gestures that we make to them.
	- Money gesture: 
		- If you came across a poor person and offered them money, they may interpret the gesture as:
			- A trick, that you will probably want something in return later on
			- Showing off to everyone that you have money
			- Thinking that you can solve everyone's problem
			- Love
	- Candy gesture: 
		- If you shared candies with a little child, the child will most likely interpret the gesture as love
		- You keep sharing candies with this child and eventually, they lose all their teeth
		- They still interpret the gesture as an act of love
		- And then they grow up and start realizing that they no longer have a perfect set of teeth, they cannot bite into most meals, and people are laughing at them, and you are the one to blame for it
		- Will they continue to interpret the candy gesture as love?
2. **Love is a form of individual interpretation:** What one person may interpret as love, may be interpreted differently by another person.
	- Scolding gesture:
		- You come across your child disrespecting an elderly person. You drag them into the house and scold them
		- The child interprets the gesture as hatred; that you do not like them
		- The child grows up to discover the benefit of treating adults with respect after your scolding had straightened them
		- Will the child continue to interpret the scolding gesture as hatred?
		- How will they interpret the gesture now that they are older?
3. What are some gestures that are always interpreted as love, no matter who is receiving it?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Biology of Love II
Understanding

1. If love is a form of interpretation of a gesture, then when given a set of individuals of various ages and backgrounds, how will you be able to identify the gesture that they will each interpret as love?
2. Can you show love to an individual without first attempting to understand them?
3. What are some things that we should try to understand about others before we attempt to show love to them?
4. In what ways can you try to understand an individual?
5. How does *observing* people help us to understand them?
6. Give examples of things that we can observe about others?
7. How does *praying* for others help you to understand them?
8. Gives examples of things that we can learn about others when we pray for them?
9. How does ***actually** listening* to others when they are talking to us, help us to understand them?
10. Gives examples of things that we can learn about others when we actually listen to them?
11. When attempting to understand adults, should we ask questions about their private lives, or wait for them to share their private lives with us, willfully?
12. What could go wrong when we ask questions about other adults' private lives and do not wait for them to share them with us willfully?
13. When attempting to understand children, should we ask questions about their private lives, or give them their privacy?
14. What could go wrong when we give children their privacy?

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Biology of Love III
Minister love, based on understanding

1. When you have understood the individual that you intend to minister love to, what is the final step?
2. Can you minister love to another person without sharing a piece of yourself with them? John 3:16
>For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
3. Did God so love the world that he said "I love you?"
4. Did God so love the world that he felt sad for the world?
5. Does God want you to love the whole world, in *words*, or one human a day, in *deed*?
6. What are some pieces of yourself that you can share with the people that you intend to love?
7. When you teach another person, do you lose what you have taught?
8. In what ways can you share your time with others?
9. In what ways can you share your money or the fruit of your hard work with others?
10. In what ways can you share your prayer with others?
11. When you pray for another person, are you sending God on an errand? 
12. In what ways does praying for another person enable God to minister his love to the person through you?
13. In what ways can you share compliments with others?
14. When you compliment others are you putting yourself above others, or pushing yourself to the background so that another person can also shine?
15. In what ways can you celebrate with others, knowing very well that you had rather be the one being celebrated?
16. In what ways can you share gifts with others?
17. In what ways can you minister love to other people, based on how you understand them?
18. In what ways can you minister love to a child?
19. In what ways can you minister love to a baby?
20. In what ways can you minister love to your parents?
21. In what ways can you minister love to your grandparents or the aged in your community?
22. In what ways can you minister love to your friends?
23. In what ways can you minister love to those who do not like you?
24. In what ways does praying for others, help you to find ways through which you can minister love to them?
25. Your baby brother and yourself, who needs more love from your parents?
26. What is the reason for your answer?
27. Your sick sister and your healthy mother, who needs more love from your father?
28. What is the reason for your answer?
29. The people who like you, and the people who do not like you, who need more love from you?
30. What is the reason for your answer?
31. Should you love everyone equally, or love as much as is needed by each individual?
32. What is the reason for your answer?
33. The people who like you and the people who do not like you, who should you show more love to?
34. What is the reason for your answer?
35. The people that are more difficult to love, and the people that are easy to love, who needs more love from you?
36. What is the reason for your answer? 
37. When you have helped in paying the school fees of another child, do you care if they fail their exams or not?
38. What is the reason for your answer?
39. Can you pray for someone every day, and wish ill upon them, at the same time?
40. Does sharing a piece of yourself with others make it easier for you to minister love to them?
41. What is the reason for your answer? 
42. In what way can you minister love to a person whom you simply don't like, and do not know why?
43. What is a rebuke?
44. When a person is going wayward and you do not rebuke them, do you love them?
45. In what ways can you rebuke a friend when they start going wayward?
46. Does God rebuke Man when they go wayward?
47. In Luke 9:46-48, how did Christ rebuke pride in his disciples?
>46 An argument started among the disciples as to which of them would be the greatest.  47 Jesus, knowing their thoughts,  took a little child and had him stand beside him.  48 Then he said to them,  “Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me.  For it is the one who is least among you all who is the greatest.”
48. In Matthew 21:12-13, how did Christ rebuke the sellers at the temple?
>12 Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers  and the benches of those selling doves.  13 “It is written,”  he said to them,  “‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a den of robbers.”
49. Get a book and name it your "Love Book". In it, every day, write down the ways in which you ministered love to one individual, following the steps outlined:
	1. Understanding
		- What did you do in order to understand them?
		- What did you understand about them?
	2. Ministered love
		- State how you ministered love to them, through understanding
	3. Outcome
		- Were your actions interpreted as love?
		- What challenges did you face, and how did you overcome them?
		- What could you have done better?
