parts.title: IV
parts.markdown:
# Biology of Love IV
Minister love, when understanding has completed its work

1. Read the story and recite it the way you remember it:
> When I was a kid, my mom often took me along on her trips. We spent a lot of time together, and she would buy me many gifts. But something odd always happened when we got back home. After getting off the bus, we would often meet one of my aunts. This aunt liked to talk a lot and would stop my mom for a long chat. She talked about her problems at home, church, school, and other random stuff. My aunt did most of the talking while my mom, who seemed to forget I was there, just listened and added a few words now and then. I would get bored, tired of waiting, and walk the rest of the way home by myself.
>
> One day, when I was a bit older, I asked my mom why she always ignored me and talked with my aunt for so long when we came back from our trips. She smiled and explained something surprising. My mom told me that my aunt was married to a man who never talked to her. She kept a lot of things inside and only felt better when she talked to my mom. My mom wanted to show her love by giving my aunt all her attention and listening to her, no matter where they met – at church, on the road, or at home.

>Hearing this, I felt sorry for getting angry and walking away from them. I understood my aunt better and decided to visit her regularly and listen to all her stories, even if they seemed boring to me.
2. What did your mum understand about your Aunt, and why she was such talkative?
3. Did your mum understand your Aunt by asking questions about your Aunt's private life, or did your Aunt most likely bring it up in one of her lengthy conversations?
4. By what means did your mum minister love to your Aunt?
5. Can giving someone a listening ear, be interpreted as love?

parts.title: V
parts.markdown:
# Biology of Love V
The Divine Technique

1. In what ways can a woman love by sharing a piece of themselves with another person, that a man cannot?
2. Are you willing to share your body with another human, allow another human to live inside your body for a couple of months, change your body and your habits, and cause you great discomfort or possibly even lose your life?
3. What is the divine technique for ministering love?
4. Is the divine technique available to women only, men only, or both?
5. Is it God's nature to share everything that he has including himself?
6. Do we live in God? Acts 17:28
> For in him we live and move and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are his offspring.’
7. In what way does the divine technique, enable a woman to imitate the very nature of God?
8. Can the spiritual value that a woman gets from using the divine technique be compared to the deformity that it causes to their flesh, shape, or form?
9. Who created all humans and brought them into existence?
10. Do all humans love God in return?
11. Does bringing a child into the world, *automatically* mean that your child will love you in return?
12. Can your child grow up to hate you and even blame you for their failure in life?
13. Can your child do some of the most hurtful things to you?
14. When they do, should you give up on them, or forgive and continue to minister love to them?
15. In what ways can your love for your child, change them and put them on the right track?
16. What is the first thing that you must do when you bring a child into the world?
17. When you are not able to win your child over to yourself, with love, can you succeed in grooming them and delivering them to their destination?
18. Does God also work to win over his children, when he brings them into being?  
19. In what ways does God work to win over humans, once they are brought into the world, with love?
20. In what ways can you win your child over, with love, so that you can successfully groom them, before delivering them to their destination?
21. Exercise:
	1. Go to your mother
	2. Find out from them their experience while pregnant with you
	3. Actually listen to what they have to say and note everything down
	4. Gather and share with the rest of the class
22. Has your mother loved you in deed or in words?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Gravity of Love
How far God is willing to go to minister his love for Humans using the same techniques in the Biology of Love

1. In what ways has God ministered his love for humans?
2. Where does the spirit of the Father, in Man, come from?
3. In what way does the Father minister his love for humans through the divine technique?
4. Who created all the different sources of energy that humans use every day?
5. Who put gold and oil in the ground, and for whom?
6. Can a human eat all the different types of foods that God has provided, in a lifetime?
7. Is the love of God all around us?
8. In what way can Man minister love to God, and God will interpret it as love? John 14:15
>“If you love me, obey my commandments.
9. Do you minister your love for God by telling him "I love you?"
10. Who created humans?
11. Is God human?
12. Does God know what it is like to be human?
13. In what way did Christ obtain his human experience?
14. Why is Christ called Son of Man and Son of God, after obtaining his human experience on earth?
15. In what ways does Christ minister his love for humans?
>John 14:14
You may ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it.

>John 14:16-17
And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, to be with you forever, even the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees him nor knows him. You know him, for he dwells with you and will be in you.

>John 16:13
But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.
16. The Father and the Son, who is love? John 3:16
> 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
17. The Father and the Son, who is love in action?
18. Does the Father minister his love for humans directly, or through the Son?
19. Why does the Father minister his love for humans through the Son?
20. Write down a hundred(100) ways you can see the love of God all around you.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Gravity of Love II
Love consequences

1. When you share a gift with your neighbor, and you experience the joy of sharing, are you more likely to share even more, next time?
2. Does love grow?
3. Where do you sow the seed of love?
4. How do you make your love grow?
5. When you teach an individual, for free, is the individual also more likely to teach other individuals for free?
6. Can a person who does not love, on receiving love from you, consider showing love for others?
7. Does love spread?
8. When you wear a smile and wave at a child, how is the child most likely to respond?
9. How do you make your love spread, even to the ends of the earth?
10. When you have a neighbor who does not like you, and you minister love to them, are they likely to change their mind about you, and even change their attitude towards you?
11. On learning that Christ was willing to live amongst men in order to teach them the ways of the Father, knowing that he will suffer horrible things and lose his own life, do you intend to live his message and be changed by it, or rather, reject it?
12. Does love change the individual receiving the love?
13. In what ways can love change the individual?
14. In what ways can love change even the most unrepentant sinner?
15. When you minister love to a wayward child, and your love never falters, is the child likely to reach a point in their lives where they begin to consider how their actions will affect you, and most likely make the right choices in order not to disappoint you?
16. Would you like to disappoint your parents after all the love they have ministered to you?
17. Would you like to disappoint your teachers after all that they have taught you?
18. Would you like to disappoint the Father after all the love he has ministered to you?
19. Does love serve as a guide and make us follow the right path?
20. In what ways can love guide an individual, and help them to walk the right path?
21. When you have given an individual a piece of yourself, does your word carry more weight with that individual, and makes them more likely to do what you tell them to do?
22. Should we use love to help each other to grow, or rather, influence others to do the wrong things?

Does love spread?
When you wear a smile and wave at a child, how is the child most likely to respond?
How do you make your love spread, even to the ends of the earth?
When you have a neighbor who does not like you, and you minister love to them, are they likely to change their mind about you, and even change their attitude towards you?

On learning that Christ was willing to live amongst men in order to teach them the ways of the Father, knowing that he will suffer horrible things and lose his own life, do you intend to live his message and be changed by it, or rather, reject it?
Does love change the individual receiving the love?
In what ways can love change the individual?
In what ways can love change even the most unrepentant sinner?

When you minister love to a wayward child, and your love never falters, is the child likely to reach a point in their lives where they begin to consider how their actions will affect you, and most likely make the right choices in order not to disappoint you?
Would you like to disappoint your parents after all the love they have ministered to you?
Would you like to disappoint your teachers after all that they have taught you?
Would you like to disappoint the Father after all the love he has ministered to you?
Does love serve as a guide and make us follow the right path?
In what ways can love guide an individual, and help them to walk the right path?
When you have given an individual a piece of yourself, does your word carry more weight with that individual, and makes them more likely to do what you tell them to do?
Should we use love to help each other to grow, or rather, influence others to do the wrong things?

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Gravity of Love III
Sons of love

1. Does the sun decide whom to shine upon?
2. Does the sun limit the extent of the reach of its light?
3. In what ways can we love like the sun?
4. Does the tree decide whom to provide shade for?
5. Does the tree decide whom to provide fruits for?
6. In what ways can we love like the tree?
7. Is the Father love?
8. Should his children also learn how to love, practice love, and become love?
9. What is the technique by which mortal man is able to become immortal?
10. Can God's children inherit immortality without imitating God by learning to love?
11. Do you have to be told to love before you start living?
12. Are you living when you do not love?

Are you living when you do not love?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Marriage

1. What is the purpose of marriage?
2. Which two individuals come together to form a marriage?
3. Which two individuals make up Man, in a marriage? Matthew 19:4-6
>4 “Haven’t you read,”  he replied,  “that at the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’  5 and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?  6 So they are no longer two, but one flesh...”
4. Why must Husband and Wife become one Man before getting married to God?
5. If the children in a marriage do not know God, nor love God, is the marriage successful?
6. When you have not been able to teach every good thing in you, to the children of the marriage, is the marriage a success?
7. When the children of the marriage do not fear God, is the marriage serving its purpose?
8. How is marriage like a factory?
9. When you build a factory, do you judge the quality of the factory by the beauty of the factory or by the quality of the product of the factory?
10. Do you build a factory that produces nothing?
11. Is a marriage useful when it is not raising new spirits in the image of God?
12. Can Man do something for God or with God? 
13. What is the reason for your answer?
14. Give examples of how Man works with God. 
15. Does Man raise the new spirits by themselves or with God?
16. Give examples of how Man can raise new spirits with God.
17. How do the Father, Son, and Spirit work together as one in Genesis 1:26 "Then God said, “Let us make mankind in our image, in our likeness..."?
18. Does the Father say to the other Gods "I am the head, everything that I say is final?"
19. If you exist today, what made it possible?
20. Should humans do their things like God?
21. Is the Husband the head of the marriage?
22. Is the Wife the head of the marriage? 
23. Who is the head of the marriage?
24. How many wives did God give Adam?
25. How many partners do you need to make Man in a marriage?
26. How do the Husband and Wife become one Man?
27. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they wear the same dress? 
28. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they live in the same house? 
29. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they sleep in the same bed? 
30. Is the Husband and the Wife one Man because they have made promises to each other? 
31. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man when it comes to punishing their children?
32. Can the child run to one of the parents when both have agreed that the child must be punished?
33. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man to find a school for their child?
34. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man when it comes to finding a school for their child when they both do not agree on the school which their child should attend?
35. How can the Husband and the Wife work together as one Man to decide the best way to raise their children?
36. What are the benefits of two joining together as one Man, in marriage?
37. Give examples of how two becoming one Man in marriage makes the Husband and the Wife safe.
38. Give examples of how two becoming one Man in marriage makes the Husband and the Wife more likely to achieve their purpose in the marriage.
39. If Eve had told Adam about the serpent, and waited for Adam to agree, would she have eaten the forbidden fruit?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Marriage II

1. When the Husband and the Wife have become one Man, what is the glue that will keep them together, and prevent them from getting separated?
2. Can the two stay together as one Man when they do not know how to forgive each other?
3. Can the two stay together as one Man when they do not have self-control?
4. Can the two stay together as one Man when they do not know how to make sacrifices?
5. Can the two stay together as one Man when they are not tolerant?
6. Can your two legs walk together in the same direction when they cannot agree on where they are going?
7. How do you develop character?
8. How do you strengthen character?
9. Is the best time to develop character, when you are a child, or when you are an adult?
10. When you drag your feet while walking, what can go wrong with your character when you grow up?
11. When you sleep a lot and wake up when you want, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
12. When you can do something today, yet you say to yourself that you will do it tomorrow, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
13. When you respond to every disagreement with an insult or your fist, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
14. When you complain when you ask your parents for something, and they ask you to wait, what could go wrong with your character when you grow up?
15. Can you develop character in a day? 
16. Can you strengthen your character in a day?
17. A person who helped their mother for one day, and a person who helped their mother for more than a year, without being forced, who is more helpful?
18. In what practical ways can you develop and strengthen your character when you are young?
19. If you cannot take care of a plant, can you take care of a human being?
20. If you cannot take care of a pet, can you take care of your children?
21. In what ways does gardening develop and strengthen your character? 
22. How does gardening teach you patience?
23. How does gardening teach you hard work?
24. How does gardening teach you discipline?
25. How does gardening teach you to be mindful of important things?
26. How does gardening teach you how to care for others?
27. In what ways does raising a pet develop and strengthen your character?
28. How does raising a pet teach you discipline?
29. How does raising a pet teach you how to care for others?
30. How does raising a pet teach you to be mindful of important things?
31. How does raising a pet teach you to be consistent?
32. Does the training for marriage begin when you are young, or when you are an adult and you have already found a partner?
33. Were the things you wanted the most as a child always the same things that you wanted the most as you grew up?
34. What is something that you wanted when you were a child, but now that you are older, you no longer want it?
35. What changed about you as you grew older?
36. Is your mind still developing?
37. Should you choose a marriage partner when you are a child or when you are an adult?
38. What could go wrong when you choose a marriage partner when you are a child and you later grow up?

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Marriage III

1. Can a person be beautiful on the outside, yet ugly on the inside?
2. Can a person be ugly on the outside, yet beautiful on the inside?
3. Can you tell a person's character by their appearance?
4. When the two become one Man, what is the glue that holds them together?
5. Who is the best judge of character?
6. Can you choose any partner at all to be joined together as one Man?
7. What could go wrong when you join with the wrong partner?
8. How can joining with the wrong partner, affect the development of the child in the marriage?
9. How do you know that a person will make a good partner in a marriage?
10. Who is the head of the marriage?
11. Who is the best person to decide if two individuals are suitable to be joined together as one Man, in a marriage?
12. In 1 Samuel 16:1-13 why did Samuel go to Jesse's house?
13. If Samuel had anointed Eliab with his oil, would Eliab have been the rightful King over Israel?
14. Was David anointed before he was chosen, or he was first chosen, and then anointed?
15. Was it the oil that made David the rightful King, or God's choice, and the oil was only meant to indicate that he had been chosen?
16. Why did God choose David to be King over Israel and not his brothers?
17. Are the two partners joining together, blessed because a pastor prays and anoints them, or they are blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
18. Are the two partners joining together, blessed because their friends think that they are great together, or they are blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
19. Are the two partners joining together, blessed because their parents agree that they are good together, or they are blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
20. Are the two partners joining together, blessed because they have signed a piece of paper, or they are blessed because God approves of them joining together as one Man?
21. In Mark 10:9, who joins together man and woman to form Man in a marriage?
> Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.
22. Can another human separate the two partners after they have been joined together in a marriage?
23. What are some things that God considers before deciding that the two will make suitable partners?
24. Can the bond between the two, be destroyed by signing a piece of paper?
25. What does it mean for a thing to be adulterated?
26. When you leave your partner to be joined with another partner, what sin have you committed?
27. In what ways does marriage benefit the man and the woman?
28. In what ways does marriage benefit the child?
29. Exercise (Based on what you have learned about marriage so far):
	1. How would you propose that a person find a marriage partner?
	2. Design how marriage should be organized, stating your reasons for the choices made in your design.
	3. Find out about how marriage is organized by your tribe, and write about it, stating the significance of every aspect of it.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Our Body

1. What are the two main parts of the body?
2. Name the visible parts of the body?
3. Name the invisible parts of the body?
4. What does your mind do?
5. What does your invisible heart do?
6. What does your conscience do?
7. Can your conscience grow?
8. How do you make your conscience grow?
9. Can your conscience die?
10. How do you kill your conscience?
11. What happens to you when your conscience finally dies?

sections.question: What are the two main parts of the body?
Name the visible parts of the body?
Name the invisible parts of the body?
What does your mind do?
What does your invisible heart do?
What does your conscience do?
Can your conscience grow?
How do you make your conscience grow?
Can your conscience die?
How do you kill your conscience?
What happens to you when your conscience finally dies?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Our Body II

1. What did God use in making your body?
2. Draw your dust body with a tree in your mind and your heart?
3. What things do you have to do to make leaves grow on the tree in your mind?
4. What happens to the leaves on the tree in your mind when you think bad thoughts?
5. What things do you have to do to make leaves grow on the tree in your heart?
6. What happens to the leaves on the tree in your heart when you sin?
7. Can you enter Heaven with your dust body?
8. How does God help you to enter Heaven?
9. Draw the spiritual body with dashed lines with a tree in your mind and your heart.
10. Why do you draw your spiritual body with dashed lines?
11. How does God create the tree in the mind of your spiritual body?
12. How does God create the tree in the heart of your spiritual body?
13. Where does your dust body go when God has finished copying the leaves from your mind and your heart?
14. Where does your spiritual body go when God has finished copying the leaves from your mind and your heart?
15. What happens to your spiritual body when God does not find anything in the heart and mind of your dust body, to copy into your spiritual body?
16. Who caused it?
17. Which body has life, the spiritual body, or the dust body?
18. What is the most beautiful thing in the whole world?
19. Is everybody around you that have a dust body alive?
20. When do you say that a person is dead?
21. When do you say that a person is sleeping?
22. If a person is alive and yet they are dead, how do you raise such a person from the dead? 
23. In Matthew 8:18-22, how can the dead bury their dead?
> 18 When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.  19 Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
>20 Jesus replied,  “Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man  has no place to lay his head.”
>21 Another disciple said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
>22 But Jesus told him,  “Follow me,  and let the dead bury their own dead.”
24. In Matthew 26:52, why does Jesus say all who draw the sword shall die by the sword?
> 48 Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.”  49 Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Greetings, Rabbi!”  and kissed him.
>50 Jesus replied,  “Do what you came for, friend.”
Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him.  51 With that, one of Jesus’ companions reached for his sword,  drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
>52 “Put your sword back in its place,”  Jesus said to him,  “for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.
25. In John 6:63 why does Jesus say
> The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you—they are full of the Spirit and life.
26. Mark 12:26-27, why does Jesus say that God is the God of the living?
> 26 Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’[a]? 27 He is not the God of the dead,  but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Our Body III
1. How many selves or personalities do you have?
2. When you say "I," how many persons are you referring to? 
3. What are the three(3) selves or personalities?
	1.  **Animal self**:
		1. What kind of mind does he have?
		2. Is his mind limited?
		3. Can his mind understand everything?
		4. What kind of body does he have?
		5. Can he easily fall sick?
		6. When your animal self starts to do away with his animal nature and rather do the will of God, which self starts to grow in him?
	2. **Higher self**
		1. What kind of mind does he have?
		2. Is his mind capable of higher reason?
		3. Can his mind understand everything?
		4. What kind of body does he have?
		5. Can he easily fall sick?
	3. **Super self**:
		1. Who is your super self?
		2. What kind of mind does he have?
		3. Is his mind infinite?
		4. Can his mind understand everything?
		5. What kind of body does he have?
4. Can your animal self communicate with your super self directly, like you would with a friend sitting in front of you?
5. How does your animal self communicate with your super self?
6. How does your super self communicate with your animal self?
7. When your animal mind is not capable of understanding an answer to your prayer, what does your super self do?
8. What happens to your higher self and your super self when you arrive in paradise?

sections.question: How many selves or personalities do you have?
When you say "I," how many persons are you referring to?
What are the three(3) selves or personalities?

How does your animal self communicate with your super self?
How does your super self communicate with your animal self?
When your animal mind is not capable of understanding an answer to your prayer, what does your super self do?
What happens to your higher self and your super self when you arrive in paradise?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Our Minds

 1. Where is your mind?
 2. Have you seen a Veronica bucket before?
 3. Draw a picture of a Veronica bucket. 
 4. When you pour water into a veronica bucket, and you open the tap, what will flow out of it?
 5. Label the veronica bucket **Water**, and label the content flowing from the tap **Water**.
 6. When you pour honey into a veronica bucket, and you open the tap, what will flow out of it?
 7. Draw another Veronica bucket.
 8. Label the veronica bucket **Honey**, and label the content flowing from the tap **Honey**.
 9. When you pour soapy water into a veronica bucket, and you open the tap, what will flow out of it?
 10. Draw another Veronica bucket.
 11. Label the veronica bucket **Soapy water**, and label the content flowing from the tap **Soapy water**.
 12. Do you know that your mind is like a Veronica bucket?
 13. Why is your mind like a Veronica bucket?
 14. When you put good songs in your mind, what will come out of your mouth when you sing?
 15. When you put gossip in your mind, what will come out of your mouth when you meet your friends?
 16. When you watch bad programs on tv, and you go to sleep at night, what will you dream about?
 17. When you put God's Word in your mind, and you sit down to think, what will you think about?
 18. Can your body do good when your mind is bad?
 19. Can your body do bad when your mind is good? 
 20. When you see a person who likes to insult, do they have a good mind or a bad mind?
 21. When you see a person who is kind with their words, do they have a good mind or a bad mind?
 22. When you see a person who likes to fight others, do they have a good mind or a bad mind?
 23. How do you put things in your mind?
 24. Should we listen to everything, if we wish to have a good mind?
 25. Give examples of things that we should listen to if we wish to have a good mind.
 26. What are some things that we should **not** listen to if we wish to have a good mind?
 27. What should we do if someone is speaking bad words into our ears?
 28. Should we look at everything if we wish to have a good mind and a good body?
 29. What are some things that we should **not** watch if we wish to have a good mind?
 30. What should we do if someone is showing us bad things?
 31. What are the things that we can do to protect our ears from listening to bad words, and our eyes from seeing bad things?
 32. What is the lamp of the body? Matthew 6:22-23
> 22 “The eye is the lamp of the body. If your eyes are healthy, your whole body will be full of light.  23 But if your eyes are unhealthy, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light within you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
 34. If you use your eyes to see what is not good, are your eyes healthy?
 35. Will your body be filled with light or darkness?
 36. How dark will the darkness be in your body?

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Our Minds II

 1. Where is your mind?
 2. How do you put things in your mind?
 3. What is a seed?
 4. Are the words that you hear with your ears and the things that you see with your eyes also seeds?
 5. What are some seeds that you can sow in your mind by watching the tv?
 6. What are some seeds that you can sow in your mind by listening to the radio?
 7. What are some seeds that you can sow in your mind by listening to your parents?
 8. What are some seeds that you can sow in your mind by watching and listening to your teacher?
 9. Is your mind like soil?
 10. Why is your mind like soil?
 11. When you sow a seed in your mind, can anybody take it from you?
 12. If the seeds in your mind cannot be stolen by any man, then what kind of seeds should you sow in your mind?
 13. When you sow a seed in your mind, how do you make it grow?
 14. When you sow gossip in your mind, and you think about it, what will it grow into?
 15. When you are insulted, and you think about it, what will it grow into?
 16. When you hear an insult, and you do **not** think about it, will it grow in your mind?
 17. When you learn about hygiene, and you think about it, what will it grow into?
 18. When you learn how to care for others, and you think about it, what will it grow into?
 19. What does the word of God in your mind, grow into, the more you think about it?
 20. In what ways have the buildings around us improved, the more we thought about them after we had learned how to build houses?
 21. In what ways have computers improved, the more we thought about them after we had learned how to build computers?
 22. Name something and say how it has improved the more we thought about it?
 23. What happens to a man who makes God the center of his thoughts?
 24. How do you make God the center of your thoughts?
 25. Does everything start from the mind?
 26. How does everything start from the mind?
 27. How does stealing start from the mind?
 28. How does showing kindness, start from the mind?
 29. Name some things around you, and how they started from the mind.
 30. Is your mind a place?
 31. What seeds do you have to sow in your mind for it to become a beautiful city?
 32. What seeds do you have to sow in your mind for it to become like a refuse dump?
 33. What seeds do you have to sow in your mind for it to become like a desert?
 34. Should we protect our minds and prevent bad seeds from getting sowed in them?
 35. What are some things that we can do to protect our minds from bad seeds?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Parenting
1. Parenting is a choice
2. A parent is the one who treats the child like their own child
	- A stranger can be a parent to the child
	- A teacher can be a parent to the child
	- A child can decide to parent another child
3. Your children cannot call you a liar, even playfully
	- Rebuke the child the moment they do this
	- The child must have absolute trust and respect for their parents
4. Don't do things that will make you lose their respect:
	- Watch how you dress 
	- Watch how you speak
	- Watch how you behave around them
		- Example of some random stranger parking their car and sexually touching the child's mother because they have a past, while the child is watching

parts.title: Developing Character
parts.markdown:
# Developing Character

1. Things that are wrong with the world because of the lack of character:
	- What are some things that are wrong with the world?
	- Troubled marriages
	- Quick money
	- Nurses disrespecting patients in the hospital
	- Chasing cars to collect payments for items sold, collecting the money from the ground
	- Banks and businesses collapsing
	- Corruption in government
2. Children are arrows:
	- Problems in the world can be solved by how we raise the next generation
	- For an arrow to be useful it has to be sharpened and directed at something specific
	- The kingdom of darkness uses an innocent-looking girl child to promote their *safe sex* agenda
3. Character is the foundation on which you can build:
	- Marriage
		- Some women get frustrated by their children
		- Some men cannot stand the cry of a child
		- Some couples abuse each other not because they are bad people
	- Business
		- Selling food requires character
		- Mandy banks were closed because of dishonesty
	- Government
		- Not everyone joins the government as a thief but eventually ends up like one
	- How does a woman raise a child and grow up to disrespect women?
	- Would you rather fight with the character of an adult than the character of a child?
4. Character traits:
	- What are some qualities that you wish to see in your child?
	- Respectable
	- Respectful
	- Self-respect
	- Accountable
	- Humble
	- Gratitude
	- Hardworking
	- God-fearing
	- Honest
	- Hygenic
	- Responsible
	- Kind
	- Committed
	- Righteous
5. How do you put character in a child:
	- Breakout session into smaller groups (10mins)
	- Select one character trait and discuss practical steps you can take in the home to put them in the child
	- Appoint a leader to share the outcome of the discussion, announce the character selected and ways to put it in the child
6. We obtain character by **practice**, not advice, not nodding our heads in agreement, etc;
7. Ways to develop the character of the child:
	- *Gardening*:	
		- What qualities do you obtain from gardening?
		- Commitment
		- Hard work
		- Consistency
		- Nurture
		- Patience
		- Build something from a humble beginning
	- *Pets*:
		- Responsible
		- Mindful
		- Caring
		- Sympathy
		- If the child can care for an animal, will they be able to care for another human?
	- *Hold hands and pray for parents once a week*
		- Can you hate someone and pray for them at the same time?
		- Makes it easy for the child to love their parents
	- *Appreciate Teachers/Parents with a letter*
		- Gratitude
	- *Cooking*:
		- Patience
		- Process/Righteousness
		- Self-control
	- *Learn how to cook by following instructions*:
		- Obedience
		- Respect for instructions
	- *Chores*:
		- Diligence
	- *Account for how the day/money was spent*
		- Accountability
		- If the child is not accountable to you, will they be accountable to God?
	- *Older child serves younger siblings*:
		- Responsibility
		- Humility
		- Patience
	- *Say something nice to someone each day:*
		- Start with greetings, ayekoo
		- Thank you to your teacher when they have finished teaching you
		- Keep a log of it
	- *Take care of appearance*:
		- They should not wear clothes with holes
		- Self-respect
		- Respectable
		- When the child loses their self-respect there are things they will do and not think twice about it
	- Join your Trade
		- They will not grow up to despise your occupation
		- Humility
		- Obedience
		- Hard work
	- Regulate their sleep, especially the girl child
		- Wake up early in the morning to sweep before everyone else is awake
		- Affects their urinating pattern, where they may grow and continue to wet their beds
		- If they sleep like they are dead, someone might sleep with them without them knowing it
		- They should sleep on a narrowly raised bed, which keeps them mindful of their sleep position even in their sleep
	- They should lift their heels when walking
		- Prevents laziness
	- Let your children greet strangers
		- You cannot live in a world where people do not greet each other
	- How teachers contribute to character development
	- Food should be dished out for them to eat in bowls, not cooking are
		- You will be teaching them greed
	- They should not play with toy guns
		- You are teaching them violence
	- They should not jump walls
	- Correcting bad character:
		- Punishment which corrects the child's character:
			- When the child sins, let them do the opposite of their sin long enough for it to erase the traces of the sin
			- Caning when used too often loses its potency and should be used rarely
		- Positive affirmations
8. Trap of parenting where the parent learns to give and the child learns to receive and is not even willing to give to the parent
9. Unsupervised training is no training
10. Other benefits of character:
	- Character is a universal currency, valuable even beyond mortal existence
	- Character prepares you for opportunities 
	- Character is a better inheritance 
11. You do not study the character of a child, you develop it
	- Be active when it comes to developing the character of the child and not a passive observer
	- There is character and there is also strength of character
	- Example of the child whose grandpa thinks he likes God, but the boy wants nothing to do with God
12. The time is now
	- You can use your eyes to correct the child
		- How I stopped speaking broken English
	- You can use your two fingers
13. Do not be discouraged
	- Parenting is a war between the parent and the heart and mind of the child
	- Children make you feel like your efforts are going nowhere
	- They make you want to give up on them
	- Training the child does not require expensive education, private schools, and international schools but the contributions of the parent the teachers and the child are fine
	- I attended a regular school even though people perceive me differently
14. Testimony (Optional)

parts.title: Developing Mind
parts.markdown:
# Developing Mind

1. *The child does not have a mind of their own*
2. *Define everything for the child*
	- Don't assume anything with children
	- What you do not define will be defined somewhere else, usually poorly
	- Example of boys talking about girls
	- Example of student listening to an announcer defining what makes a man
3. *Define the child to the child*
	- You are a gentleman, lady
	- You are not like them
4. *Let them know what you expect from them*
	- What you expect from them is not a house or a car, but to see what God has  put in them come out, flourish, and be used to help others
	- You will be disappointed to see them abort what God has put in them
	- God will also be disappointed
5. *Let them decide the kind of person they wish to become*
	- The kind of person they wish to become is more important than the career they wish to pursue
	- I do not like children who can speak good English but are full of rubbish
	- Saves them from jumping onto every ship
	- Let them tell you what they have to start doing now to achieve that
	- Welbeck example
6. *Developing a growth mindset by keeping a growth book*
	- Frequently ask them about their growth
7. *Get inside the mind of the child, caning only touches the body of the child and should be used sparingly for it to have any effect*
	- You do that with questions
	- Example of how I get the child to stop playing with guns
	- Example of how I get Welbeck to change behavior without applying force
	- How my mother got me to go to church
8. *Teach them with questions:*
	- Activates their thinking
	- Is this the right thing to do?
	- Will this help you to grow?
9. *Socialize the child*
	- Let the child be around you while you perform certain actions
	- Talk while taking walks
10. *Don't get tired of speaking to the child*
	- Children will make you feel like you are wasting your time talking
	- When you are not around, it is your voice that will remind them to do the right thing
11.  *The child has a conscience*:
		- Quiet Time
		- Fear of God (Teach the child the laws of God)
12. *It matters what you say to the child*
	- As a parent, your words carry more weight
	- You are a gentleman, lady
13. *Correcting the child*
	-  The best way to correct a child is with a soft voice
	- A loud voice only makes them hardened
	- Wake them up early in the morning and speak with them about their actions
	- You can also express disappointment
14. A well-developed mind is an inheritance:
	- Your treasures are in your heart and your mind
	- Wisdom 
	- Teachings
	- Socialization
	- Example of my mum being encouraged by seeing a woman who used farming to take her son through school to become a doctor
15. Teach the child your process:
	- Let the child know how they became the way they are because of your process
	- Some adults think that they were born good
	- When they adult do not know the process they end up having bad children even though they are good
	- Some grandparents always had some poultry or animal that they always reared but did not kill to eat

parts.title: Protecting the child
parts.markdown:
# Protecting the child

1. *What is your first responsibility toward the child?*
2. *The child is the prize of the marriage*
	- You can lose the child even though the child is living with you
	- When you lose the child, your marriage has lost its meaning
3. How do you protect the child?
4. *How do you protect the body of the child?*
	- Clothing
	- Shelter
	- Good food
	- Not drinking ice water
5. *How do you protect the mind of the child?*
	- Control what they watch and what they hear
		- TV and radio
		- Trotro
		- Funerals
	- Control the kind of people you bring them around
6. *How do you protect the innocence of the child?*
	- The purpose of innocence
		- Certain things cannot be taught to the child when they lose their innocence
		- Losing their innocence can send them spiraling to a fall
	- Teach them to close their legs when they sit
	- Wear clothes that actually cover their bodies
		- Some men do not know the difference between a girl and a woman
	- Do not expose them to sexual content
	- Do not have an affair while they are around
	- How Joan got raped as a child
7. *Establish a policy of transparency*
	1. Sit by the beds on weekends and inquire about what is going on in their lives
	2. Listen to their stories after school and offer perspective
	3. The story of Erica when her friend tries to introduce her to witchcraft
8. *Establish a policy of walking in pairs*
	1. They only do what they both agree on
	2.  
9. *Traps to avoid:*
	- Keep your eyes on the prize
		- Avoid marital distractions
		- How to steal the chicks of a chicken
	- Smartphones
		- Mostly used for pornography leading to masturbation instead of research
		- Enables predators to circumvent the parents and directly destroy the child
		- Laptops instead of smartphones
		- The story of Afia Blinks
	- TV 
		- Fetish priests owing TV channels
		- Children now practicing invoking spirits
		- Nana Saforoh now educating children about relationships
	- Radio
		- Fetish teachings
			- Horoscopes

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Prayer

1. What are some things that God has created?
2. Who created your body?
3. Who created the food that you eat?
4. Who created Mom and Dad?
5. Who created the trees?
6. Who created the water that you drink?
7. Draw 5 things that God has created.
8. Did God create these things for himself or you?
9. When somebody gives you something or does something for you, what do you say to the person?
10. Pray and thank God for 5 things that God has done for you.
11. What do you say to God before you eat the food that he has provided for you?
12. What do you say to God before you go to sleep at night?
13. What do you say to God when you wake up in the morning? 
14. When you finish praying should you wait for a while to hear from God, or just get up and leave? Matthew 26:36-44
> 36 Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.” 37 He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee. Grief and anguish came over him, 38 and he said to them, “The sorrow in my heart is so great that it almost crushes me. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
> 
> 39 He went a little farther on, threw himself face downward on the ground, and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, take this cup of suffering from me! Yet not what I want, but what you want.”
> 
> 40 Then he returned to the three disciples and found them asleep; and he said to Peter, “How is it that you three were not able to keep watch with me for even one hour? 41 Keep watch and pray that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
> 
> 42 Once more Jesus went away and prayed, “My Father, if this cup of suffering cannot be taken away unless I drink it, your will be done.”
> 43 He returned once more and found the disciples asleep; they could not keep their eyes open.
> 
> 44 Again Jesus left them, went away, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Prayer II

1. Can you see God?
2. In what way has God made it possible for you to communicate with him when you cannot see him?
3. What makes you open your mouth to speak a word?
4. What are *motives, intents, meanings, motivating thoughts*?
5. Does God know your *motives, intents, meanings, motivating thoughts*?
6. Does God need you to speak a word before he knows your *motives, intents, meanings, motivating thoughts*?
7. If you knew what a person *meant* before they spoke, will you wait to hear what they had to say before finding out their *meaning*?
8. Do words have value in prayer?
9. If you know that your friend *intends* to give you a gift, do you go ahead and take the gift?
10. If words are valueless in prayer, why does God require you to speak when you pray, anyway?
11. If words are valueless in prayer, should you use a lot of words when you pray, in order to try to impress God? 
12. Does God answer your prayers based on your *motives, intents,  meanings, motivating thoughts*, or the words that you speak when you pray?
13. Should you be sincere when you pray (say what you *mean*), or say one thing when you *mean* another?
14. In what ways do humans say one thing when they *mean* another?
15. In what ways can you be sincere in your prayers?
16. When you plant crops close to a river and you want the river to flow to the crops, what will you have to do?
17. Can you move the crops to the river, the river to the crops, or dig trenches from the river to the crops so that the river would flow to the crops?
18. If God was an endless, boundless river, and your body was the land, and your mind, heart, conscience, etc. were the crops, how will you be able to let God, which is the river, flow to the crops, your will, heart, mind, conscience, desires, tongue?
19. If God was an endless river flowing from within you, and you wanted him to fill all the members of your body(heart, mind, will, conscience, etc.) what will you have to do?
20. How do you fill your mind with God?
21. How do you fill your heart with God?
22. How do you fill your conscience with God?
23. In Luke 22:42 how did Christ give his will to the Father?
> Not my will, but yours be done 
24. What kind of things will you wish for when your heart has been filled with God? 
25. How will you think when your mind has been filled with God?
26. How will you behave the more trenches you dig in yourself for God to fill?
27. Are you more likely to do the will of God when you are filled with God?
28. Will you fall into temptations when the members of your body are filled with God?
29. Are you likely to make the right choices when the members of your body have been given to God and filled with God?
30. When you have a difficult decision to make, do you ask God to fill you so that you can make the right choice, or do you worry?
31. When you are faced with challenges should you ask God to take away the challenge, or fill yourself with God through prayer, so that you will be able to go through it?
32. When things are not going your way, should you complain to God, or fill yourself with God through prayer, so that you will know the right thing to do?
33. Is prayer for filling ourselves with God in order to do the will of God, or prayer is for instructing God, and telling God what to do?
34. Did God create Man before creating his food, or his food before creating Man?
35. Did God wait for the Man to pray for food before providing him with his food?
36. Has God provided all your needs?
37. Should you use prayer to ask God for *things* (money, clothes, shoes, etc.)?
38. Who is the first person you must talk to when you wake up in the morning?
39. Fill yourself with God through prayer.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Prayer III

1. During creation, did God create Man's food before creating Man, or Man before his food, after Man had prayed for food?
2. Has God provided all the *things* that you will ever need in this world?
3. When you pray should you ask God for material things?
4. When building a house, what materials do you need in order to complete the house, and how do they add value to the house?
5. When you build a house without wisdom, what will happen to the house?
6. Can you build a house without wisdom?
7. What are values?
8. Why is patience valuable?
9. Why is the fear of God valuable?
10. Why is humility valuable?
11. Why is wisdom valuable?
12. Is wisdom a material value or spiritual value?
13. Name three(3) material values that are needed in building a house?
14. Name three(3) spiritual values that are needed in building a house?
15. What are the differences between spiritual values and material values?
16. Which is more important, spiritual values or material values, and why?
17. Can spiritual values be taken away from you?
18. Are spiritual values useful no matter where you find yourself, even in Heaven?
19. Do spiritual values lose their value over time?
20. Do you have all the spiritual values that you will ever need?
21. When you pray should you ask God for material things or spiritual values?
22. What are some spiritual values that you wish to have?
23. Use prayer to ask God for spiritual values

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Speak Life

1. Show me your tongue
2. What does your tongue do in your mouth?
3. Roll back your tongue and try to speak
4. Can you speak without your tongue?
5. If you were driving a car, and you wanted it to go in a particular direction, which part of the car will you use?  
6. If you were riding a horse, and you wanted it to go in a particular direction, what will you use?  
7. How will you control the direction of a ship?  
8. Will the ship be useful without a steering wheel?
9. Do you know that your body also has a steering wheel that controls what your body will do?
10. What is the steering wheel of your body?  
11. If you said to yourself "I am good for nothing," what will your body do?  
12. Did you speak life or *death*?
13. If you tried remembering something, and you found it difficult, and you said to yourself "I will remember it," what is your mind most likely to do?
14. Did you speak life or *death*?
15. If you tried remembering something, and you found it difficult, and you said to yourself "Oh I have forgotten it" what is your mind likely to do?
16. Did you speak life or *death*?
17. When you are faced with a problem and you say to yourself, "I do not know how to solve this problem" what is your body likely to do?
18. Did you speak life or *death*?
19. When you are faced with a problem and you say to yourself, "How do I solve this problem?" what is your mind likely to do?
20. Did you speak life or *death*?
21. When your teacher gives you a lot of homework, and you are feeling lazy, how do you speak life?
22. When you are given a difficult problem to solve and you are struggling to understand the problem, how do you speak life?
23. When you have formed a bad habit, and you are struggling to come out of it, how do you speak life?
24. When your tongue always puts you in trouble, how do you speak life?
25. Is God life or *death*? 
26. Should God's children speak life or *death*? 
27. When you wake up feeling sick, do you say "I am dead!" or "I shall be well!"?
28. When your heart is struck with fear, do you speak fear and doubt or do you speak courage?
29. In what ways can you speak courage?
30. When nothing is going well for you and you are feeling lost, do you say "I will come out of this!" or do you keep quiet and suffer?
31. Speak life in ten(10) different ways!

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Speak Life II

1. Can you eat food into another person's stomach?
2. Can you turn the steering wheel of your car, and it will change the direction of another person's car?
3. If someone spoke *death* to you "You will not understand the subject!" will you fail to understand?
4. What if someone spoke *death* to you "You will not understand the subject!" and then you also agreed with them, by repeating to yourself "I will not understand the subject," what will your body do?
5. If someone spoke life to you "You shall overcome!" will you be able to overcome?
6. What if someone spoke life to you "You shall overcome!" and then you also agreed with them, by repeating to yourself "I shall overcome," what will your body do?
7. How should we speak to ourselves when another person speaks *death* to us?
8. How should we speak to ourselves when another person speaks life to us?
9. How should we respond when a person speaks *death* to themselves?
10. Speak life to yourself every day when you wake up, especially after your morning worship when you are filled with *spiritual energy*.

What if someone spoke life to you "You shall overcome!" and then you also agreed with them, by repeating to yourself "I shall overcome," what will your body do?

How should we speak to ourselves when another person speaks life to us?
How should we respond when a person speaks *death* to themselves?
Speak life to yourself every day when you wake up, especially after your morning worship when you are filled with *spiritual energy*.

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Speak Life III

1. Are you aware of yourself and your environment?
2. What is consciousness?
3. Are you conscious?
4. Is each cell in your body aware of itself, its environment, and the work that it does in your body?
5. Does each cell in your body have consciousness?
6. Can consciousness be divided?
7. Are you made up of one big ball of consciousness or you are made up of individual consciousnesses?
8. Can the members of your body receive instructions and be able to act on them?
9. Which member of your body instructs the remaining members of your body?
10. When you speak life, what will the members of your body do?
11. When you speak death what will the members of your body do?
12. Should you speak life or death?
13. When you are struck with sickness how do you speak life?
14. When your mind is filled with unpleasant thoughts, do you speak life or do you keep quiet and hope that the unpleasant thoughts go away?
15. When your mind is filled with unpleasant thoughts how do you speak life?
16. When you are confused, how do you speak life?
17. When you keep falling back into bad habits, how do you speak life?
18. How do you speak life, to consecrate the members of your body to God, each day?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Trinity

1. Have you seen a flame before?
2. When another flame comes out of the original flame, does the original flame lose its power?
3. Is the new flame different from the original flame?
4. Is the new flame, less powerful than the original flame?
5. Why is God like a flame?
6. Is God able to divide himself without losing himself?
7. Who is the original flame?
8. What does the Father do, personally?
9. If the Father gives personality to all individuals, is he a personality himself, or a super personality?  
10. Should you say that you have a certain personality because of the day that you were born? 
11. Who is the second flame to come out of the original flame?
12. Why is the Son also called the Word? John 1:1
>In the beginning, was the Word,  and the Word was with God,  and the Word was God.
13. Is the Word a person or a book?
14. Has anybody seen the Father before?
15. If you wish to know what the Father has to say, whom do you go to?
16. How did humans know the words of the Father in Matthew 5:48?
>Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
17. What else does the Son do apart from being the Word? John 1:1-3
> In the beginning was the Word,  and the Word was with God,  and the Word was God.  2 He was with God in the beginning.  3 Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made. 
18. Who created our universe and everything in it including humans?
19. In Genesis 1:3, who said let there be light, and who created the light?
> And God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.
20. Who is the third flame to come out of the original flame?
21. What does the Spirit do, personally? John 6:63
> It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh profits nothing; the words that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.
22. What makes the three Gods, Father, Son, and Spirit a Trinity?
23. How do the three Gods, Father, Son, and Spirit agree as one?
24. In Genesis 1:26, who is God, and who is "us?"
> Then God said, “Let us make mankind in our image, in our likeness, so that they may rule over the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky,  over the livestock and all the wild animals, and over all the creatures that move along the ground.”
25. Will you exist if all but one member of the Trinity does not agree?
26. What does it mean to be *just*?
27. Can the Father be *just* without the agreement of the Trinity?
28. Is every new flame that comes out of the Father also God?
29. Which other flames came out of the Father, who is also God but not the Father?
30. In Isaiah 11:2, who are the seven Spirits of God?
> 1. The Spirit of Wisdom  
> 2. The Spirit of the Lord  
> 3. The Spirit of Understanding
> 4. The Spirit of Counsel  
> 5. The Spirit of Power  
> 6. The Spirit of Knowledge
> 7. The Spirit of the Fear of the Lord
31. Where does the spirit of God in man come from?
32. Does God dwell in Time, Eternity, or both?
33. Is Eternity a long time?
34. What is the reason for your answer?
35. Is Eternity and Time the same thing or completely different?
36. How do things happen in Time?
37. How do things happen in Eternity?
38. What is the Eternal life? John 17:3
> 3 Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.
39. Can you live the Eternal life when you do not know God?
40. Can you live the Eternal life when you do not think like God?
41. Can you live the Eternal life when you do not speak like God?
42. Can you live the Eternal life when you do not act like God?
43. When do you say that a person has Eternal life?
44. Do you dwell in Time or Eternity?
45. Is everything created?
46. Is God created or uncreated?
47. Who created existence?
48. Does God *exist*, or God *Is*, and it is through him that other beings are brought into existence? Exodus 3:14
> God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM”; and He said, “You shall say this to the Israelites, 'I AM has sent me to you. ' ”
