sections.body:
> 1. The Spirit of Wisdom  
> 2. The Spirit of the Lord  
> 3. The Spirit of Understanding
> 4. The Spirit of Counsel  
> 5. The Spirit of Power  
> 6. The Spirit of Knowledge
> 7. The Spirit of the Fear of the Lord

sections.question: Where does the spirit of God in man come from?
Does God dwell in Time, Eternity, or both?
Is Eternity a long time?
What is the reason for your answer?
Is Eternity and Time the same thing or completely different?
How do things happen in Time?
How do things happen in Eternity?
What is the Eternal life? John 17:3
sections.body: > 3 Now this is eternal life: that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.

sections.question: Can you live the Eternal life when you do not know God?
Can you live the Eternal life when you do not think like God?
Can you live the Eternal life when you do not speak like God?
Can you live the Eternal life when you do not act like God?
When do you say that a person has Eternal life?
Do you dwell in Time or Eternity?
Is everything created?
Is God created or uncreated?
Who created existence?
Does God *exist*, or God *Is*, and it is through him that other beings are brought into existence? Exodus 3:14
sections.body: > God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM”; and He said, “You shall say this to the Israelites, 'I AM has sent me to you. ' ”

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# The Trinity II

1. In John 3:16, who is God, and who is his one and only son?
>For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
2. Who created all things? John 1:1-3
> In the beginning was the Word,  and the Word was with God,  and the Word was God.  2 He was with God in the beginning.  3 Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made.
3. Did Christ exist after he was born in this world, or he has always been, and it is through him that all humans exist? John 8:48-58
> 48 The Jews answered him, “Aren’t we right in saying that you are a Samaritan  and demon-possessed?”
> 
> 49 “I am not possessed by a demon,”  said Jesus,  “but I honor my Father and you dishonor me.  50 I am not seeking glory for myself; but there is one who seeks it, and he is the judge.  51 Very truly I tell you, whoever obeys my word will never see death.”
> 
> 52 At this they exclaimed, “Now we know that you are demon-possessed! Abraham died and so did the prophets, yet you say that whoever obeys your word will never taste death.  53 Are you greater than our father Abraham?  He died, and so did the prophets. Who do you think you are?”
> 
> 54 Jesus replied,  “If I glorify myself,  my glory means nothing. My Father, whom you claim as your God, is the one who glorifies me.  55 Though you do not know him,  I know him.  If I said I did not, I would be a liar like you, but I do know him and obey his word.  56 Your father Abraham  rejoiced at the thought of seeing my day; he saw it and was glad.”
> 
> 57 “You are not yet fifty years old,” they said to him, “and you have seen Abraham!”
> 
> 58 “Very truly I tell you,”  Jesus answered,  “before Abraham was born,  I am!”
4. Is Christ God?
5. Did Christ come into the world as a man, doing God's will, or as God? John 14:10
> 10 Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and that the Father is in me? The words I say to you I do not speak on my own authority. Rather, it is the Father, living in me, who is doing his work.
6. Did Christ go through the various stages and challenges of life as a man or as God?
7. From his childhood, did Christ know that he was God? Mark 10:17-18
> 17 As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. “Good teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
> 
> 18 “Why do you call me good?”  Jesus answered.  “No one is good—except God alone.
8. Did Christ learn about the Father, and start his fellowship with the Father the same way as every other human would have, by going to Sunday school, studying the scriptures, and doing the will of the Father, until he and the Father had become one? 
>Luke 2:46
>After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the  teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
>
>Luke 2:52
> “And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.”
9. Who confirmed Jesus Christ as a true child of God, when his will and the Father's will had become one, after doing God's will for a long time? Matthew 3:13-17
> 13 Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to be baptized by John. 14 But John tried to deter him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?”
> 
> 15 Jesus replied,  “Let it be so now; it is proper for us to do this to fulfill all righteousness.”  Then John consented.
> 
> 16 As soon as Jesus was baptized, he went up out of the water. At that moment heaven was opened,  and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting on him.  17 And a voice from heaven  said,
> “This is my Son,  whom I love; with him I am well pleased.”
10. Will you also receive a confirmation from the Father in your spirit when your will and the Father's will have become one after doing his will for some time? 
11. In John 10:10, who is the thief, what does he want, and what does Christ want for every human?
>The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
12. Who gave you life?
13. If Satan can make you turn against your Father in Heaven has he stolen you from him?
14. In what ways does Satan try to destroy the children of God?
15. Will Satan try to kill you if all his attempts fail?
16. In what way did Christ expect people to know who he was? John 10:24-25
> 24 The Jews who were there gathered around him, saying, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly.”
> 
> 25 Jesus answered,  “I did tell you,  but you do not believe. The works I do in my Father’s name testify about me,
17. Are you *something* because of what you do every day, or what you say that you are?
18. How is Christ the way to the Father? John 14:4-6
> 4 You know the way to the place where I am going.” 5 Thomas  said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going, so how can we know the way?”
> 
> 6 Jesus answered,  “I am the way and the truth and the life.  No one comes to  the Father except through me.
19. What examples did Christ *do* and *teach* humans as the way to become like Christ? (Read the Gospels)
20. Can you believe in Christ without practicing his teachings?
21. Which examples of Christ are you following now?
22. Was Christ willing to forgive the people who had tortured him and hanged him on the cross to die? Luke 23:34
> 34 Jesus said, “Father,  forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
23. Which character and mind will be formed in you when you believe in Christ by acting on his word?
24. How can Christ be formed in you?
25. When you blow air into a balloon and place it on a bucket of water will it float or will it sink? 
26. When you press the balloon to the bottom of the bucket and you leave it what will happen to the balloon?
27. In John 11:20-26, how is Christ the resurrection and the life? 
> 20 When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed at home.
> 
> 21 “Lord,” Martha said to Jesus, “if you had been here, my brother would not have died.  22 But I know that even now God will give you whatever you ask.”
> 
> 23 Jesus said to her,  “Your brother will rise again.”
> 
> 24 Martha answered, “I know he will rise again in the resurrection  at the last day.”
> 
> 25 Jesus said to her,  “I am the resurrection and the life.  The one who believes in me will live, even though they die;  26 and whoever lives by believing in me will never die.  Do you believe this?”
28. When you do not have the character and mind of Christ can you be resurrected?
29. In what way is a person who has become like Christ, like a balloon?
30. Through Christ, should there be other Christs?
31. Does Christ's resurrection teach humans that when a man has formed Christ in them, they are *capable* of being resurrected, and that resurrection is *possible*?
32. Did Christ wish to go through the suffering on the cross, or he went through it because it was the Father's will? 
> “Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.”
33. Are you also willing to do the Father's will even when it does not make you happy?
34. Did the people of his day find it easy to accept the teachings of Christ, including the disciples?
35. Did the disciples believe that Christ would resurrect after his death on the cross? John 20:24-29
> 24 Now Thomas  (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.  25 So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!”
> 
> But he said to them, “Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side,  I will not believe.”
> 
> 26 A week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said,  “Peace  be with you!”  27 Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe.”
> 
> 28 Thomas said to him, “My Lord and my God!”
> 
> 29 Then Jesus told him,  “Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”
36. Did Christ know that for the people to truly believe him he had to give them a sign? Matthew 12:38-39
> 38 Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law said to him, “Teacher, we want to see a sign  from you.”
> 
> 39 He answered,  “A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a sign! But none will be given it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
37. What sign would he give them to make them believe?
38. If Christ had not died in public, would his resurrection have meant anything to the people of his day? 
39. If Christ had not resurrected from the dead, would his message have taken deeper roots in the hearts of the people, making them believe that all that he said was true? John 11:25
> Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die;
40. When the people believed him after his resurrection were they willing to spread the message to other towns and even die while doing so?
41. In what way did the Father use Christ's public humiliation and death on the cross to make Christ's message take deeper roots in the hearts of men after his resurrection, to the point where they were willing to die for it?
42. Did the Father use what the Devil had planned for evil, for good, by letting Christ go through public humiliation and death, or did the Father plan to have Christ crucified all along?
43. Can humans enter God's kingdom and be saved from darkness if only they will believe in Christ's teachings?
44. If the price to pay for Christ's message to be accepted by the people was death by the cross, and later resurrection, was Christ willing to do what it would take by paying the price?
45. Did the Father pay the price by giving his very best, his only begotten son?
46. Does the Father allowing Christ to go through so much suffering teach humans how far he is willing to go to rescue even the most stubborn human from darkness?
47. Does Christ humbling himself even unto death, teach humans how far we must be willing to go to do God's will?
48. Can the problem of humans living in darkness, and dying because of it, be solved?
49. Is there a price to pay to solve it?
50. Are you willing to pay the price?
51. Did Christ come to replace the laws of the prophets, or improve upon them and give them their full meaning? Matthew 5:33-37, Matthew 5:38-39, Matthew 19:8-11, Matthew 5:43-46, Matthew 5:27-28, Matthew 5:17
>Matthew 5:33-37
>33 “Again, you have heard that it was said to the people long ago, ‘Do not break your oath, but fulfill to the Lord the vows you have made.’ 34 But I tell you, do not swear an oath at all: either by heaven, for it is God’s throne; 35 or by the earth, for it is his footstool; or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the Great King. 36 And do not swear by your head, for you cannot make even one hair white or black. 37 All you need to say is simply ‘Yes’ or ‘No’; anything beyond this comes from the evil one.
>
>Matthew 5:38-39 
>38 “You have heard that it was said, ‘Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.’ 39 But I tell you, do not resist an evil person. If anyone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to them the other cheek also.
>
>Matthew 19:8-11
>8 Jesus replied,  “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard. But it was not this way from the beginning.  9 I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another woman commits adultery.”
>
>Matthew 5:43-46
>43 “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’ 44 But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, 45 that you may be children of your Father in heaven. He causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous. 46 If you love those who love you, what reward will you get? Are not even the tax collectors doing that?
>
>Matthew 5:27-28
>27 “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’ 28 But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
>
>Matthew 5:17
>Don't suppose I came to do away with the Law and the Prophets. I did not come to do away with them, but to give them their full meaning.
52. Does following Christ's teachings mean that you no longer have to obey the law? Matthew 5:19
> Therefore anyone who sets aside one of the least of these commands and teaches others accordingly will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever practices and teaches these commands will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
53. Can you become perfect by following laws alone?
54. What is the reason for your answer?
55. Do the laws of God cover every aspect of human living and behavior?
56. Can you become perfect by following the laws of God and Christ who by taking on human nature also understands you and knows how to deal with the things that stop you from becoming perfect? Matthew 5:20
> For I tell you that unless your righteousness surpasses that of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law, you will certainly not enter the kingdom of heaven.
57. Did Christ come to start a new religion named after him, or to establish the kingdom of God on earth?
58. Where is the kingdom of God on earth? Luke 17:20-21
> 20 And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
> 
> 21 Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
59. How do you enter God's kingdom?
60. Can you enter God's kingdom without submitting yourself to God, daily? Luke 22:42
>“Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.”
61. Did the Jews accept or reject Christ's teachings? John 10:20-21
> 20 Many of them said, “He is demon-possessed and raving mad. Why listen to him?”
> 
> 21 But others said, “These are not the sayings of a man possessed by a demon.  Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
62. What would happen to Jerusalem shortly after Christ had been taken up into Heaven? Luke 19:41-44
>41 As he approached Jerusalem and saw the city, he wept over it  42 and said,  “If you, even you, had only known on this day what would bring you peace—but now it is hidden from your eyes.  43 The days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and encircle you and hem you in on every side.  44 They will dash you to the ground, you and the children within your walls.  They will not leave one stone on another,  because you did not recognize the time of God’s coming  to you.”
63. When Christ was about to be crucified, and the women wept for him, why did he say to them "Weep for yourselves"? Luke 23:27-28
>27 A large number of people followed him, including women who mourned and wailed for him.  28 Jesus turned and said to them,  “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me; weep for yourselves and for your children.
64. What happened to Jerusalem shortly after Christ had been taken up into Heaven?
65. If the Jews had accepted Christ's message would the Romans have destroyed their cities and temples and killed so many of them?
66. If all men accept God as their Father, will they treat each other as brothers and sisters, or as foreigners and enemies? John 4:7-9
> 7 When a Samaritan woman came to draw water, Jesus said to her,  “Will you give me a drink?”  8 (His disciples had gone into the town  to buy food.)
> 
> 9 The Samaritan woman said to him, “You are a Jew and I am a Samaritan woman. How can you ask me for a drink?” (For Jews do not associate with Samaritans.)
67. If all men accept each other as brothers and sisters, will they continue to fight each other or allow the peace of God to reign on earth?
68. What is a parable?
69. What is the parable of the tenants? Luke 20:9-19
> 9 He went on to tell the people this parable:  “A man planted a vineyard,  rented it to some farmers and went away for a long time. 
> 10 At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants so they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him and sent him away empty-handed.  11 He sent another servant, but that one also they beat and treated shamefully and sent away empty-handed.  12 He sent still a third, and they wounded him and threw him out.
> 
> 13 “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my son, whom I love;  perhaps they will respect him.’
> 
> 14 “But when the tenants saw him, they talked the matter over. ‘This is the heir,’ they said. ‘Let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’  15 So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
> 
> “What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?  16 He will come and kill those tenants  and give the vineyard to others.”
> 
> When the people heard this, they said, “God forbid!”
> 
> 17 Jesus looked directly at them and asked,  “Then what is the meaning of that which is written:
> 
> “‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone’?
> 
> 18 Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces; anyone on whom it falls will be crushed.”
> 
> 19 The teachers of the law and the chief priests looked for a way to arrest him immediately, because they knew he had spoken this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.
70. What does the vineyard represent in the parable?
71. Who is the owner of the vineyard? 
72. Who are the tenants? Matthew 23:29-35
> 29 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.  30 And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’  31 So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.  32 Go ahead, then, and complete  what your ancestors started!
> 
> 33 “You snakes! You brood of vipers!  How will you escape being condemned to hell?  34 Therefore I am sending you prophets and sages and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify;  others you will flog in your synagogues  and pursue from town to town.  35 And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel  to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah,  whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
73. In what ways did the tenants beat and treat the servants shamefully?
74. What is the fruit of the vineyard?
75. Who were the servants sent to the vineyard to collect the fruits of the vineyard?
76. Who was the son sent to collect the vineyard's fruits?
77. Did Christ come into the world to be humiliated and killed or to draw men into the Father's kingdom by his teachings and lifestyle?
78. Was Christ sacrificed or betrayed and murdered? Acts 7:52-53
>52 Was there any prophet that your ancestors did not persecute? They killed God's messengers, who long ago announced the coming of his righteous Servant. And now you have betrayed and murdered him. 53 You are the ones who received God's law, that was handed down by angels—yet you have not obeyed it!”
79. What is the harvest, and who are the laborers? Matthew 9:35-38
>35 And Jesus went throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom and healing every disease and every affliction.  36 When he saw the crowds,  he had compassion for them, because they were harassed and helpless,  like sheep without a shepherd.  37 Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few;  38 therefore pray earnestly to the Lord of the harvest to  send out laborers into his harvest.”
80. Was Christ able to forgive sins before he was crucified? Matthew 9:2-7
> 2 Some men brought to him a paralyzed man,  lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith,  he said to the man,  “Take heart,  son; your sins are forgiven.”
> 
> 3 At this, some of the teachers of the law said to themselves, “This fellow is blaspheming!”
> 
> 4 Knowing their thoughts,  Jesus said,  “Why do you entertain evil thoughts in your hearts?  5 Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?  6 But I want you to know that the Son of Man  has authority on earth to forgive sins.”  So he said to the paralyzed man,  “Get up, take your mat and go home.”  7 Then the man got up and went home.
81. Did humans have to spill the blood of Christ to be forgiven of their sins?
82. In what way does Christ take away the sin of the world? John 1:29
> The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
83. In what way did Christ fulfill the prophecy of Isaiah in Isaiah 53:4? Matthew 8:14-17
> 14 When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.  15 He touched her hand and the fever left her, and she got up and began to wait on him.
> 
> 16 When evening came, many who were demon-possessed were brought to him, and he drove out the spirits with a word and healed all the sick. 17 This was to fulfill  what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:
> 
> “He took up our infirmities   and bore our diseases.”

84. What is the story of the woman caught in adultery? John 8:1-11
> 8 1 but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
> 
> 2 At dawn he appeared again in the temple courts, where all the people gathered around him, and he sat down to teach them. 3 The teachers of the law and the Pharisees brought in a woman caught in adultery. They made her stand before the group 4 and said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of adultery. 5 In the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women. Now what do you say?” 6 They were using this question as a trap, in order to have a basis for accusing him.
> 
> But Jesus bent down and started to write on the ground with his finger. 7 When they kept on questioning him, he straightened up and said to them, “Let any one of you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her.” 8 Again he stooped down and wrote on the
> ground.
> 
> 9 At this, those who heard began to go away one at a time, the older ones first, until only Jesus was left, with the woman still standing there. 10 Jesus straightened up and asked her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one condemned you?”
> 
> 11 “No one, sir,” she said.
> 
> “Then neither do I condemn you,” Jesus declared. “Go now and leave your life of sin.”
85. Was it possible for humans to stop sinning before Christ was crucified? John 8:11
86. How do you stop sinning?
87. Was Christ able to teach all that he wanted to before he was taken up into Heaven? John 16:12
>“I have much more to say to you, more than you can now bear.
88. How did Christ know that the people could not bear all that he had to say to them? John 3:1-12
> 3 Now there was a Pharisee, a man named Nicodemus  who was a member of the Jewish ruling council.  2 He came to Jesus at night and said, “Rabbi,  we know that you are a teacher who has come from God. For no one could perform the signs  you are doing if God were not with him.”
> 
> 3 Jesus replied,  “Very truly I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless they are born again.”
> 
> 4 “How can someone be born when they are old?” Nicodemus asked. “Surely they cannot enter a second time into their mother’s womb to be
> born!”
> 
> 5 Jesus answered,  “Very truly I tell you, no one can enter the kingdom of God unless they are born of water and the Spirit.  6 Flesh gives birth to flesh, but the Spirit gives birth to spirit.  7 You should not be surprised at my saying, ‘You must be born again.’  8 The wind blows wherever it pleases. You hear its sound, but you cannot tell where it comes from or where it is going. So it is with everyone born of the Spirit.”
> 
> 9 “How can this be?”  Nicodemus asked.
> 
> 10 “You are Israel’s teacher,”  said Jesus,  “and do you not understand these things?  11 Very truly I tell you, we speak of what we know,  and we testify to what we have seen, but still you people do not accept our testimony.  12 I have spoken to you of earthly things and you do not believe; how then will you believe if I speak of heavenly things?
89. Who will continue his work after he has been taken up into Heaven? John 16:13
>But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.
90. While on earth why did Christ call himself the Son of Man? Matthew 8:20
> “And Jesus said to him, ‘Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.’”
91. Is human experience already in God from the beginning, or is human experience obtained by living like a human?
92. Did Christ rule over our universe after creating it, or did he wait until he had first put on human nature, thereby becoming both Son of God and Son of Man? Matthew 28:16-18
> 16 Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.  17 When they saw him, they worshiped him; but some doubted.  18 Then Jesus came to them and said,  “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
93. Who gave Christ all authority?
94. What did Christ have after his resurrection, that he did not have before his crucifixion? Matthew 28:18
> 18 Then Jesus came to them and said,  “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
95. What could go wrong if Christ ruled our universe after creating it, without first putting on human nature?
96. What can go wrong when you try advancing a child when you have never been a child before?
97. In Matthew 23:11 why does the Father (through Christ) say
> The greatest among you must be a servant.
98. Would Christ use his authority over Man, fairly, if he had not first obtained a human experience, and known what it was like to be human? Luke 23:34, Luke 5:21-22
> Luke 23:34
> Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
> 
> Luke 5:21-22
> 21 The Pharisees and the teachers of the law began thinking to themselves, “Who is this fellow who speaks blasphemy? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
>22 Jesus knew what they were thinking and asked,  “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?
99. If God himself goes through the proper way to assume authority, should humans also learn to do things the proper way?
100. Did Christ live his life on earth by seeking the will of the Father and doing it? John 6:38
> For I have come down from heaven not to do my will but to do the will of him who sent me.
101. Should humans also spend their lives seeking the will of God and doing it?
102. Was Christ able to fulfill the law? Matthew 5:17
>“Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.
103. Is Christ able to help you fulfill the law as well?

sections.question: In John 3:16, who is God, and who is his one and only son?
sections.body: >For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

sections.question: Who created all things? John 1:1-3
sections.body: > In the beginning was the Word,  and the Word was with God,  and the Word was God.  2 He was with God in the beginning.  3 Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made.

sections.question: Did Christ exist after he was born in this world, or he has always been, and it is through him that all humans exist? John 8:48-58
sections.body:
> 48 The Jews answered him, “Aren’t we right in saying that you are a Samaritan  and demon-possessed?”
> 
> 49 “I am not possessed by a demon,”  said Jesus,  “but I honor my Father and you dishonor me.  50 I am not seeking glory for myself; but there is one who seeks it, and he is the judge.  51 Very truly I tell you, whoever obeys my word will never see death.”
> 
> 52 At this they exclaimed, “Now we know that you are demon-possessed! Abraham died and so did the prophets, yet you say that whoever obeys your word will never taste death.  53 Are you greater than our father Abraham?  He died, and so did the prophets. Who do you think you are?”
>

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# The Trinity III

1. Who will continue the work of Christ on earth after he has ascended into Heaven? John 14:16-17
> 16 I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, who will stay with you forever. 17 He is the Spirit, who reveals the truth about God. The world cannot receive him, because it cannot see him or know him. But you know him, because he remains with you and is in you.
2. Which kind of people cannot receive the Holy Spirit?
3. Why can't the people of the world receive the Holy Spirit?
4. Will the Holy Spirit ever leave you after you have received him?
5. In what ways will the Holy Spirit help you?
> John 16:13
> But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.
>
>John 14:26
>26 The Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything and make you remember all that I have told you.
>
>John 16:13
>13 When, however, the Spirit comes, who reveals the truth about God, he will lead you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own authority, but he will speak of what he hears and will tell you of things to come.
>
>Acts 1:8
>8 But when the Holy Spirit comes upon you, you will be filled with power, and you will be witnesses for me in Jerusalem, in all of Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
6.  Is the Holy Spirit a person, a thing, or a dove?
7. If Christ did not ascend into Heaven, would the Holy Spirit be sent to earth? John 16:7
> 7 But I am telling you the truth: it is better for you that I go away, because if I do not go, the Helper will not come to you. But if I do go away, then I will send him to you.
8. Can you live the life of Christ without the Holy Spirit?
9. Will God give you the Holy Spirit if you ask? Luke 11:9-13
> 9 “So I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you;  seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.  10 For everyone who asks receives; the one who seeks finds; and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
11 “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead?  12 Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?  13 If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
10. Do you wish to receive the Holy Spirit?
11. In Acts 2:1-4, what happened to the disciples on the day of Pentecost?
> 2 When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.  2 Suddenly a sound like the blowing of a violent wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.  3 They saw what seemed to be tongues of fire that separated and came to rest on each of them.  4 All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit enabled them.
12. Has the Holy Spirit been sent down on earth?
13. When was the Holy Spirit sent down on earth?
14. When the disciples received the Holy Spirit what was the first thing they did? 
15. When you receive the Holy Spirit will there be a visible sign?
16. When you receive the Holy Spirit will you also be able to speak in other tongues?
17. Does speaking in tongues align your will with the will of God?
18. Pray and thank God for the gift of the Holy Spirit. 
19. Since the Holy Spirit has already been sent down, you only have to ask the Holy Spirit to come and fill you in Jesus' name. After praying, open your mouth and speak whatever language the Spirit enables you to speak.
20. In what way does John the Baptist baptize? Matthew 3:11
> 11 I baptize you with water to show that you have repented, but the one who will come after me will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire. He is much greater than I am; and I am not good enough even to carry his sandals.
21. In what way does Jesus Christ baptize?
22. Which baptism is greater?
23. Speak in tongues as often as you can and follow the leadings of the Spirit

sections.question: Who will continue the work of Christ on earth after he has ascended into Heaven? John 14:16-17
sections.body: > 16 I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, who will stay with you forever. 17 He is the Spirit, who reveals the truth about God. The world cannot receive him, because it cannot see him or know him. But you know him, because he remains with you and is in you.

sections.question: Which kind of people cannot receive the Holy Spirit?
Why can't the people of the world receive the Holy Spirit?
Will the Holy Spirit ever leave you after you have received him?
In what ways will the Holy Spirit help you?
sections.body:
> John 16:13
> But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.
>
>John 14:26
>26 The Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything and make you remember all that I have told you.
>
>John 16:13
>13 When, however, the Spirit comes, who reveals the truth about God, he will lead you into all the truth. He will not speak on his own authority, but he will speak of what he hears and will tell you of things to come.
>
>Acts 1:8
>8 But when the Holy Spirit comes upon you, you will be filled with power, and you will be witnesses for me in Jerusalem, in all of Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”

sections.question: Is the Holy Spirit a person, a thing, or a dove?
If Christ did not ascend into Heaven, would the Holy Spirit be sent to earth? John 16:7
sections.body: > 7 But I am telling you the truth: it is better for you that I go away, because if I do not go, the Helper will not come to you. But if I do go away, then I will send him to you.

sections.question: Can you live the life of Christ without the Holy Spirit?
Will God give you the Holy Spirit if you ask? Luke 11:9-13
sections.body:
> 9 “So I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you;  seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.  10 For everyone who asks receives; the one who seeks finds; and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
11 “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead?  12 Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?  13 If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”

sections.question: Do you wish to receive the Holy Spirit?
In Acts 2:1-4, what happened to the disciples on the day of Pentecost?
sections.body: > 2 When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.  2 Suddenly a sound like the blowing of a violent wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.  3 They saw what seemed to be tongues of fire that separated and came to rest on each of them.  4 All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit enabled them.

When was the Holy Spirit sent down on earth?
When the disciples received the Holy Spirit what was the first thing they did?
When you receive the Holy Spirit will there be a visible sign?
When you receive the Holy Spirit will you also be able to speak in other tongues?
Does speaking in tongues align your will with the will of God?
Pray and thank God for the gift of the Holy Spirit.

textLessons.title: Two Kinds of Humans in This World

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Two Kinds of Humans in This World

1. What is a parable?
2. If a story does not teach a lesson is it a parable?
3. Have you seen wheat before?
4. What are some uses of wheat?
5. Have you seen a weed before?
6. Pull out a weed from around you and show it to your instructor.
7. Can you cook a weed and eat it?
8. When a weed grows around a tomato plant, will the tomato grow properly and be reddish?
9. What is the reason for your answer?
10. What do we do with weeds?
11. When a weed grows around a plant that you intend to eat, what do you do with it?
12. In Matthew 13:24-30, what is the parable of the Wheat and the Weeds?
13. If you plant a good seed, can it grow into a bad tree?
14. Can a tomato grow into a banana tree?
15. From the parable, how did the man know that an enemy had planted weeds in his field?
16. In verse 29, why did the man not want the servants to remove the weeds?
17. Do the weeds and the wheat look very much alike?
18. Why will the servants accidentally pull out the wheat?
19. From this parable, who is the man who planted the good seeds?
20. What are the good seeds?
21. Who are the servants?
22. Who is the enemy who planted the weeds?
23. What are the weeds?
24. What does the field represent?
25. In verse 30, what will happen to the weeds?
26. In Matthew 13:37-43, how does Christ explain the parable of the wheat and the weeds?
27. Is a human being a seed?
28. What is the reason for your answer?
29. From the explanation above, who is the man who planted the good seeds?
30. What are the good seeds?
31. Who are the servants?
32. Who is the enemy who planted the weeds?
33. What are the weeds?
34. What does the field represent?
35. Are all humans put here by Christ?
36. Who are the two kinds of humans in this world?
37. Do the children of the Devil and the children of God look-alike in the beginning when they are born?
38. What are some things that the child of the Devil will do to expose who they are?
39. Did all the teachings of Christ stop Judas Iscariot from betraying him?
40. Can the seeds of the enemy receive the Holy Spirit? John 14:16-17
> 16 I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, who will stay with you forever. 17 He is the Spirit, who reveals the truth about God. The world cannot receive him, because it cannot see him or know him. But you know him, because he remains with you and is in you.
41. What are the fruits of the seeds of God, when they are fed with the word of God?
42. In the end, what will happen to every human who was not put here by Christ?
43. What will the children of the Devil attempt to do to the seeds that were put here by Christ?
44. Is life on earth going to be easy for the children of God, as long as the children of the Devil remain on earth?
45. Does being a child of God mean that you automatically accept God as your father?
46. Pray to God, accept him as your father, and ask him to take you as his child and make you what he wishes to make of you.
47. In Matthew 10:34, what does a sword do?
>34 “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I have not come to bring peace, but a sword.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Two Kinds of Humans in This World II

1. Who are the two kinds of humans in this world?
2. In Matthew 13:31-32, what is the parable of the mustard seed?
> 31 Jesus told them another parable: “The Kingdom of heaven is like this. A man takes a mustard seed and sows it in his field. 32 It is the smallest of all seeds, but when it grows up, it is the biggest of all plants. It becomes a tree, so that birds come and make their nests in its branches.”
3. What is the meaning of the parable? 
4. When the word of God is taught to the child of the kingdom who appears little or insignificant, and they practice it, are they able to grow up to become mighty like the mustard seed, and do far better than the seeds of the enemy who may appear bigger and more intelligent in the beginning? 
5. Can the children of the devil be so transformed by the word of God that they grow to become mighty like the mustard seed?
6. When teaching the word of God, should you look down on those who are little, can barely speak up, and struggle to understand what you are teaching?
7. What is the meaning of Matthew 13:33?
> 33 Jesus told them still another parable: “The Kingdom of heaven is like this. A woman takes some yeast and mixes it with a bushel of flour until the whole batch of dough rises.”
8. What is the flour?
9. What does the yeast represent?
10. If you wish to grow as a child of God, what do you have to do?
11. In Matthew 13:34-35, how long have these things been kept secret from mankind?
> 34 Jesus used parables to tell all these things to the crowds; he would not say a thing to them without using a parable. 35 He did this to make come true what the prophet had said,
“I will use parables when I speak to them;  
I will tell them things unknown since the creation of the world.”
12. In Matthew 13:47-50, what is the parable of the fishing net?
> 47 “Also, the Kingdom of heaven is like this. Some fishermen throw their net out in the lake and catch all kinds of fish. 48 When the net is full, they pull it to shore and sit down to divide the fish: the good ones go into the buckets, the worthless ones are thrown away. 49 It will be like this at the end of the age: the angels will go out and gather up the evil people from among the good 50 and will throw them into the fiery furnace, where they will cry and gnash their teeth.
13. What is the meaning of the parable?
14. Is Christ looking for all humans or only those who belong in the kingdom?
15. When you are teaching the word of God, should you be in a hurry to separate the good seeds from the bad seeds, or first gather all the people that you can, teach them, treat them equally, and let them eventually set themselves apart?
16. In Matthew 18:10, what does it mean to despise a little child who belongs in the kingdom?
> 10 “See that you don't despise any of these little ones. Their angels in heaven, I tell you, are always in the presence of my Father in heaven.
17. Should you treat a little child as if they were nothing because they are little?
18. What do their angels do before the Father in his presence?
19. Are their angels able to carry out instructions from the Father on their behalf?
20. In Matthew 18:12-14, what is the parable of the lost sheep?
> 12 “What do you think a man does who has one hundred sheep and one of them gets lost? He will leave the other ninety-nine grazing on the hillside and go and look for the lost sheep. 13 When he finds it, I tell you, he feels far happier over this one sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not get lost. 14 In just the same way your Father in heaven does not want any of these little ones to be lost.
21. Does the shepherd go looking for a sheep that did not originally belong to them?
22. Did the children of God belong to the Father from the beginning?
23. Does the Father treat his children as numbers, or as only begotten?
24. What does it mean to be an only-begotten child, when you have many siblings?
25. When the Father loses you to the lies and deceit of the Devil, will he continue to be happy because he has many other children, or he will be sad and do whatever he can to get you back?
26. Does the Father love each of his children as if they were his only child?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Worship

1. What are some things that you do when you worship something?
2. Do you sing songs of adoration to what you worship?
3. Do you show respect for what you worship?
4. Do you listen to and obey what you worship?
5. Do you love and admire what you worship?
6. Is worship the highest form of admiration?
7. Do you give your time and attention to what you worship?
8. When you worship a person and you like the kind of clothes that they wear, what kind of clothes will you buy when you walk into a clothing store?
9. When you worship a person and you like their hairstyle, how will you style your hair?
10. How will you speak?
11. When you dress like the person, style your hair like the person, and speak like the person, what kind of person are you becoming?
 3. What do you become when you worship something? 
 4. What do you become when you worship a stone? 
 5. When you worship a stone, will you grow or die? 
 6. What do you become when you worship a tree?  
 7. What do you become when you worship another person?  
 8. What then should you worship?   
 9. What do you become when you worship God?
 10. Does God want you to worship him so that he will feel big?
 11. Does your worship make God bigger than he is, or does your worship make the amount of God in you, grow?
 12. When you worship other things apart from God, what sin have you committed?
 13. How can your sickness become an idol to you?
 14. How can money become an idol to you?
 15. How can your stomach become an idol to you?
 16. How can you become an idol to yourself?
 17. If anything takes your attention from God, is it an idol?
 18. What other things can become idols to you?
 19.  Can you look inside a bottle with both eyes?
 20. Can you worship both God and other things at the same time?
 21. When God says that you shall not worship other gods besides him, does it mean there are other gods just like him?
 22. What is the reason for your answer?
 23. What is the only thing a human can do that other animals cannot?
 24. Why does God give humans the ability to worship?
 25. When you meet someone, how do you tell if they worship the right thing?
 26. Can you tell if a person worships the right thing by how they treat other humans?
 27. Can you tell if a person worships the right thing by their love for God?
 28. In what ways will you worship God starting today?
 29. Write down 10 ways you will worship God when you wake up and draw your first breath.

parts.title: II
parts.markdown:
# Worship II

1. Who is God to you?
2. Read Isaiah 6:1-4
> 6 In the year that  King Uzziah died I  saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up; and the train of his robe filled the temple.  2 Above him stood the seraphim. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.  3 And one called to another and said:
> 
> “Holy, holy, holy is the  Lord  of hosts;   the whole earth is full of his glory!”
> 
> 4 And the foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.  
3. If you were prophet Isaiah and you saw this vision of God sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, what would this tell you about God?
4. Is God a king?
5. Is God Holy?
6. If God is a king then how should we conduct ourselves before him?
7. Where did the train of God's robe or garment fill?
8. Does God live in temples?
9. Is your body God's temple?
10. What is the reason for your answer?
11. How should you treat your body if it is a temple of God?
12. Should you think carelessly?
13. Should you speak anyhow?
14. Should you dress anyhow, or dress majestically like God?
15. Should you be profane?
16. In verse 5, why did prophet Isaiah feel the way he did?
> 5 And I said: “Woe is me! For I am lost; for I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts!”
17. In verse 6, why did the seraphim touch prophet Isaiah's mouth with the burning coal?
> 6 Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a burning coal that he had taken with tongs from the altar.  7 And he  touched my mouth and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away, and your sin atoned for.”
18. Was God the one who told the prophet Isaiah that he was unclean?
19. How did the prophet Isaiah know that he was unclean?
20. What happened to his guilt after his sins were atoned for?
21. When we wish to speak with God, should we go straight to the point or should we start with thanksgiving, praises, and adoration?
22. Give thanks for 10 things that God has done for you. 
23. Give God praises and adoration.

Read Isaiah 6:1-4

parts.title: III
parts.markdown:
# Worship III

1. What does *worship* change the *worshipper* into?
2. Is it God's nature to share all he has, including himself?
3. Who first had life, and chose to share that life with his children?
4. In what way does God share himself with his children?
5. Is God a gardener and someone who loves nature and beautiful flowers and loves to care for them?
6. In what way does the Garden of Eden show God's love for nature, and beauty and how he cares for them?
7. Is God gentle, sensitive, and also, thoughtful?
8. In what way does God creating Eve out of Adam show God's gentle, sensitive, and thoughtful nature?
9. Is God orderly and does he follow process to get things done?
10. Does God like to do excellent things and pay attention to details?
11. How does the building of the Ark of the Covenant show God's devotion to excellence and attention to detail? Exodus 31:1-5
> Then the  Lord said to Moses,  2 “See, I have chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur,  of the tribe of Judah,  3 and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skills—  4 to make artistic designs for work in gold, silver and bronze,  5 to cut and set stones, to work in wood, and to engage in all kinds of crafts.
12. Is God majestic and also a King? 
13. Will the worshipper of God Most High, also become majestic like a king, gentle, caring, sensitive, orderly, thoughtful, sharing, etc?
14. Does God want you to worship him because someone asked you to, or because you understand why you worship?
15. What is intelligent worship?
16. Should you ask God for *things* when you worship?
17. What is true worship?
18. What kind of energy do you receive from God when you worship him with spiritual songs?
19. How does spiritual energy help you when you face difficulties in life?
20. How does spiritual energy help you when it comes to being sensitive to the spirit?
21. Do you know that your body is a temple and God lives in you?
22. What should you do if you wish to feel the presence of God in you?
23. Does God expect you to worship more than you pray, or pray more than you worship?
24. What is the reason for your answer?
25. Name a song you can use to worship God each morning when you wake up before you start your day.
26. Worship God with the song [We Give You Glory Lord As We Honour You](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7gvxW42K7w&pp=ygUZa2FobGVobyB5b3UgYXJlIHdvbmRlcmZ1bA%3D%3D "KALEHO - We Give You Glory Lord As We Honour You (You are Wonderful) ft. Evans Ogboi")

sections.question: What does *worship* change the *worshipper* into?
Is it God's nature to share all he has, including himself?
Who first had life, and chose to share that life with his children?
In what way does God share himself with his children?
Is God a gardener and someone who loves nature and beautiful flowers and loves to care for them?
In what way does the Garden of Eden show God's love for nature, and beauty and how he cares for them?
Is God gentle, sensitive, and also, thoughtful?
In what way does God creating Eve out of Adam show God's gentle, sensitive, and thoughtful nature?
Is God orderly and does he follow process to get things done?
Does God like to do excellent things and pay attention to details?
How does the building of the Ark of the Covenant show God's devotion to excellence and attention to detail? Exodus 31:1-5
sections.body: > Then the  Lord said to Moses,  2 “See, I have chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur,  of the tribe of Judah,  3 and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skills—  4 to make artistic designs for work in gold, silver and bronze,  5 to cut and set stones, to work in wood, and to engage in all kinds of crafts.

sections.question: Is God majestic and also a King?
Will the worshipper of God Most High, also become majestic like a king, gentle, caring, sensitive, orderly, thoughtful, sharing, etc?
Does God want you to worship him because someone asked you to, or because you understand why you worship?
What is intelligent worship?
Should you ask God for *things* when you worship?
What is true worship?
What kind of energy do you receive from God when you worship him with spiritual songs?
How does spiritual energy help you when you face difficulties in life?
How does spiritual energy help you when it comes to being sensitive to the spirit?
Do you know that your body is a temple and God lives in you?

textLessons.title: A Better Way to say Thank You

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# A Better Way to say Thank You
Jesus teaches us how we can become better.

1. When you are hungry and a stranger offers you food, what do you say to them?
2. When you meet another stranger who is hungry and you have food yet you sneer at them and refuse to give them food, were you really thankful when you were offered food and you said: "Thank you?"
3. When you meet a hungry stranger and you share the little food you left with them, were you really thankful when you were offered food and said: "Thank you?"
4. Which is a better way to say thank you, by your lips only, or by your lips and your actions towards another person who also needs your help?
5. What is the best way to say "Thank you" to your teacher when you have been taught a lesson and meet another person who does not know that lesson and wishes to learn it? Matthew 18:21-35

sections.question: When you are hungry and a stranger offers you food, what do you say to them?
When you meet another stranger who is hungry and you have food yet you sneer at them and refuse to give them food, were you really thankful when you were offered food and you said: "Thank you?"
When you meet a hungry stranger and you share the little food you left with them, were you really thankful when you were offered food and said: "Thank you?"
Which is a better way to say thank you, by your lips only, or by your lips and your actions towards another person who also needs your help?
What is the best way to say "Thank you" to your teacher when you have been taught a lesson and meet another person who does not know that lesson and wishes to learn it? Matthew 18:21-35

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Automatic Responsibility

 1. If many people were gathered, including adults and children, and suddenly, everybody left except you and a little child, and the child went climbing a tree nearby and fell and broke his arm, and an adult rushed to the place, who will be blamed for the child's accident?  
2. The child was not left in your care so why will you be blamed?  
3. Who is wiser, you or the child? 
4. Does being wiser, or better at something, than someone else makes you automatically responsible for teaching them?
5. If you are the only person who knows how to read, who is automatically responsible for teaching those around you who cannot read?  
6. If you are the only well-behaved person around many people are not well-behaved, who is automatically responsible for teaching them how to behave properly?  
7. Is it okay for you to be the only person who does not use abusive words in your community?  
8. What other things are you automatically responsible for simply because you find yourself in someplace with a certain group of people eg. class, home, or community?  
9. Can God confidently count on you to perform your automatic responsibilities towards the people around you?
10. When you are preparing a bowl of soup, do you need salt as much as the bowl of soup, to make the soup taste good?
11. Are you enough to change the people around you?

Who is wiser, you or the child?
Does being wiser, or better at something, than someone else makes you automatically responsible for teaching them?
If you are the only person who knows how to read, who is automatically responsible for teaching those around you who cannot read?
If you are the only well-behaved person around many people are not well-behaved, who is automatically responsible for teaching them how to behave properly?
Is it okay for you to be the only person who does not use abusive words in your community?
What other things are you automatically responsible for simply because you find yourself in someplace with a certain group of people eg. class, home, or community?
Can God confidently count on you to perform your automatic responsibilities towards the people around you?
When you are preparing a bowl of soup, do you need salt as much as the bowl of soup, to make the soup taste good?
Are you enough to change the people around you?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Be Transparent

1. When do you say that something is transparent?
2. What are some things that are transparent?  
3. When do you say that a person is transparent?
4. How do you make yourself transparent?
5. How does being transparent with your parents help them to keep you safe?
6. How does being transparent with your parents help them to help you out of bad habits?
7. How does being transparent with God, enable him to lead you out of temptation?
8. Draw a lion. 
9. Draw a group of sheep. 
10. Draw a circle around the sheep. 
11. Draw another sheep who has separated himself from the group of sheep.
12. Who is the lion more likely to attack? The group of sheep, or the single sheep?  
13. What will happen to you when you separate yourself from the people practicing good?
14. What can happen to you when someone makes you think that you can do it on your own, without God's help or your parents?

When do you say that a person is transparent?
How do you make yourself transparent?

How does being transparent with God, enable him to lead you out of temptation?

Draw a group of sheep.
Draw a circle around the sheep.
Draw another sheep who has separated himself from the group of sheep.

What will happen to you when you separate yourself from the people practicing good?
What can happen to you when someone makes you think that you can do it on your own, without God's help or your parents?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Becoming

1. When you teach other people what you know what do you become?
2. When you help those who are in need what do you become?
3. When you heal people and make them feel better what do you become?
4. Do you become what you do?
5. What do you wish to become?
6. What do you have to do to become what you wish to become?
7. What do you have to do to become a child of God?
8. Can you become a child of God when you do not do the same things that God also does?
9. When you steal what do you become? 
10. When you insult others what do you become?
11. When you cheat others what do you become?
12. When a soup becomes rotten what do you do with it?
13. Do you know that you can also become like a rotten soup?
14. What are some things that when you do, will make you become like a rotten soup?
15. What will happen to you when you become like a rotten soup?
16. Does God create bad people?
17. Why do some people become good and others become bad?
18. Pray and tell God the kind of person that you wish to become and ask him to help you.

When you heal people and make them feel better what do you become?

What do you wish to become?

What will happen to you when you become like a rotten soup?
Does God create bad people?
Why do some people become good and others become bad?
Pray and tell God the kind of person that you wish to become and ask him to help you.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Birthright

1. When do you say that something is your birthright?
2. What is your birthright because you are born to your parents?
3. What is your birthright because you are a child of God?
4. Is the knowledge of God your birthright?
5. Is God your birthright?
6. Can you lose your birthright?
7. In Genesis 25:19-34, what is the story of Jacob and Esau?
8. What was Esau's birthright?
9. Who took Esau's birthright from him?
10. Was it a demon that took Esau's birthright?
11. Was it a witch that took Esau's birthright?
12. Why did God say that he hated Esau?
13. In Revelation 3:8, what does an opened door represent?
>I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an open door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.
14. What does it mean to have the door shut?
15. Who will try to shut this door; a demon, witch, or human being?
16. How will a human being attempt to take your birthright from you, or make you lose it?
17. How will a human being attempt to close the opened door before you when you start teaching others the word of God?
18. How will a human being attempt to close the opened door before you when you start living your life to please God, and not Man?
19. How will a human being attempt to close the opened door before you when you start waking up early in the morning to fellowship with God?
20. How can you protect your birthright?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Faith, Believe

1. Are you able to hear the voice of God? John 10:27-28
>27 My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
28 And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.
2. When do you say that you have **faith**?
3. Can you say you have faith when God has not spoken to you?
4. When you have faith will you doubt it?
5. When you are not sure if you heard from God, is it faith?
6. Is faith a feeling?
7. Will God tell you to do something big when you have not done the little thing he has asked you to do?
8. Will God give you big faith when you have not acted on the little faith that he has given you?
9. Can your faith grow?
10. How do you make your faith grow?
11. Give an example of how you can make your faith grow
12. Do you wish to hear God's voice?
13. What is living faith?
14. If the faith that you have received is from a book that you have read, is it living faith?
15. If the faith you have is a word that you have received from God concerning a specific situation, is it a living faith?
16. Give examples of living faith
17. When do you say that you **believe** something?
18. When you receive faith and act on it, do you believe?
19. When you receive faith, and you do not act on it, do you believe?
20. Do you believe by your words or by your actions?
21. If you say that you believe, yet do not act on it, do you believe?
22. If you say that you do not believe, yet act on it, did you believe?
23. In Matthew 14:22-33, what is the story?
24. Where do you find faith?
25. Where do you find belief?
26. What would have happened if Peter tried walking on the water without first receiving a word from Christ?
27. If you believe in the word God has spoken to you, will anything be impossible to you? Matthew 17:20
> He replied, “Because you have so little faith. Truly I tell you, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”
28. In Matthew 19:16-22 what is the story of Jesus and the Rich Young Ruler?
> 16 Just then a man came up to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to get eternal life?”
> 
> 17 “Why do you ask me about what is good?”  Jesus replied.  “There is only One who is good. If you want to enter life, keep the commandments.”
> 
> 18 “Which ones?” he inquired.
> 
> Jesus replied,  “‘You shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony,  19 honor your father and mother,’ and ‘love your neighbor as yourself.’”
> 
> 20 “All these I have kept,” the young man said. “What do I still lack?”
> 
> 21 Jesus answered,  “If you want to be perfect,  go, sell your possessions and give to the poor,  and you will have treasure in heaven.  Then come, follow me.”
> 
> 22 When the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had great wealth.
29. Where do you find faith?
30. Did the Rich Young Ruler believe?
31. What is the reason for your answer?
32. Did Jesus ask the Rich Young Ruler to say "I believe that you are the son of God?"
33. Did Jesus ask the Rich Young Ruler to give all his riches to him?
34. In John 11:19-44, what is the story?
35. Where do you find faith?
36. In verse 27, did Martha believe?
37. In verses 39-40, did Martha believe?
38. When did they believe?
39. Can you believe in God, and not do what God tells you to do?
40. How do you believe in John 3:16?
> For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
41. Is there greatness in every man?
42. Why is there greatness in every man?
43. Why are some people great, and others are not? 
44. When God gives you his word does he also provide the power to do it?
45. When you act on the word of God shall anything be impossible to you?
46. **Quiet Time**: Each day, you wake up early in the morning to spend time with God alone. You do 4 things;
		1. Sing a spiritual song to God
		2. Pray
		3. Study God's word - this could be your bible (you can start with the gospels; Matthew, Mark, Luke, John), a lesson, and so on. You can also write some notes based on your experience.
		4. Meditate -  think about what you have learned and ways that you can begin to apply them.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Fasting

1. How many kinds of food must a person eat each day?
2. What are they?
3. What does it mean to feed on the word of God?
4. If you hear God's word and you do not practice it, have you fed on the word of God?
5. What happens to your spirit when you hear God's word and practice it?
6. What is a fast?
7. When you fast, which of the two(2) kinds of food are you feeding on?
8. Should you listen to the voice of God while you fast?
9. Does fasting also humble you before God? Deuteronomy 8:3, Matthew 4:1-4
>Deuteronomy 8:3
>3 So He humbled you, allowed you to hunger, and fed you with manna which you did not know nor did your fathers know, that He might make you know that man shall not live by bread alone; but man lives by every _word_ that proceeds from the mouth of the Lord.
>
> Matthew 4:1-4
> 4 Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.  2 After fasting forty days and forty nights,  he was hungry.  3 The tempter  came to him and said, “If you are the Son of God,  tell these stones to become bread.”
4 Jesus answered,  “It is written: ‘Man shall not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.’”
10. In Daniel 10:1-12, what is the story?
11. In Daniel 10:12, how did Daniel humble himself?
> 12 Then he said, “Daniel, don't be afraid. God has heard your prayers ever since the first day you decided to humble yourself in order to gain understanding. I have come in answer to your prayer.
12. When fasting should we live by every word that comes from the mouth of God?
13. When should you begin a fast?
14. Should you feel hungry during a fast? 
15. When should you end a fast? Matthew 4:2
> After fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.
16. Should you end your fast when you start feeling hungry?
17. Begin a fast according to a time of your choosing
18. Do you realize now that you can live on God's word alone?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Forgive
1. Imagine that you had a good friend who helped you with many things that would have been difficult or even impossible had you done them alone. One day, your friend offends you and makes you very angry. You can only imagine what you will say or do to them when you meet them. Now you have two choices, the friendship that you had with them, or your anger.  
2. What will happen if you choose friendship?
3. Will you be able to continue working with them?
4. Will you have to avoid them, anytime you meet them?
5. What will happen if you choose your anger?
6. Will you be able to continue your friendship with them?
7. Will you have to avoid them, anytime you meet them?
8. What look would you have to wear on your face if you had to be in the same place with them?
9. Will you choose friendship or your anger?
10. If you chose friendship, what do you have to do in response to the offense?
11. Should your friend know that they have been forgiven?
12. What will happen if you forgave them, but did not let them know that they had been forgiven?
13. How will you let your friend know that you have forgiven them?
14. Will your friends, parents, or even siblings one day offend you?
15. Why will they offend you no matter what?
16. Will you forgive them now, or you will wait until after they have offended you first and said apologized?
17. Do you **fore**give be**fore** or after you have been offended?
18. After offending someone, what do you carry on your conscience?
19. What happens when you sprinkle water over hot oil on a fire?
20. What causes the guilt in your conscience after you have offended someone?
21. When you feel guilty, can you carry out your duties like before?
22. When you are forgiven, what happens to your guilt? Isaiah 6:1-7
> In the year that  King Uzziah died I  saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up; and the train of his robe filled the temple.  2 Above him stood the seraphim. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.  3 And one called to another and said:
> 
> “Holy, holy, holy is the  Lord  of hosts;   the whole earth is full of his glory!”
> 
> 4 And the foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.  5 And I said: “Woe is me!  For I am lost;  for I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the  Lord  of hosts!”
> 
> 6 Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a burning coal that he had taken with tongs from the altar.  7 And he  touched my mouth and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away, and your sin atoned for.”
24. If you were starting a journey, and you were told that one mistake on your journey would lead to your death, and you knew that you were not perfect so you were definitely going to make a mistake, would you go on the journey at all?
25. Can you become perfect at something without a second or multiple attempts?
26. If you do not forgive the people who offend you, will they get another chance to do better? 
27. How does forgiving others help them to become perfect? 
28. When a person insults you for no reason at all, do you just stay silent and not mind them, or do you show them an act of love by saying "Thank you!" with a smile?
29. Who forgives best, the one who does nothing when they are offended, or the one who responds with kindness?
30. In Matthew 5:39 what did Jesus mean by turning the other cheek?
>39 But I tell you, do not resist an evil person. If anyone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to them the other cheek also.
31. Is forgiveness needed in Heaven?
32. What is the reason for your answer
33. Is there someone that you have not forgiven?
34. If yes, then what are you waiting for?

sections.question: Imagine that you had a good friend who helped you with many things that would have been difficult or even impossible had you done them alone. One day, your friend offends you and makes you very angry. You can only imagine what you will say or do to them when you meet them. Now you have two choices, the friendship that you had with them, or your anger.
What will happen if you choose friendship?
Will you be able to continue working with them?
Will you have to avoid them, anytime you meet them?
What will happen if you choose your anger?
Will you be able to continue your friendship with them?
Will you have to avoid them, anytime you meet them?
What look would you have to wear on your face if you had to be in the same place with them?
Will you choose friendship or your anger?
If you chose friendship, what do you have to do in response to the offense?
Should your friend know that they have been forgiven?
What will happen if you forgave them, but did not let them know that they had been forgiven?
How will you let your friend know that you have forgiven them?
Will your friends, parents, or even siblings one day offend you?
Why will they offend you no matter what?
Will you forgive them now, or you will wait until after they have offended you first and said apologized?
Do you **fore**give be**fore** or after you have been offended?
After offending someone, what do you carry on your conscience?
What happens when you sprinkle water over hot oil on a fire?
What causes the guilt in your conscience after you have offended someone?
When you feel guilty, can you carry out your duties like before?
When you are forgiven, what happens to your guilt? Isaiah 6:1-7
sections.body:
> In the year that  King Uzziah died I  saw the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up; and the train of his robe filled the temple.  2 Above him stood the seraphim. Each had six wings: with two he covered his face, and with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.  3 And one called to another and said:
> 
> “Holy, holy, holy is the  Lord  of hosts;   the whole earth is full of his glory!”
> 
> 4 And the foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.  5 And I said: “Woe is me!  For I am lost;  for I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; for my eyes have seen the King, the  Lord  of hosts!”
> 
> 6 Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a burning coal that he had taken with tongs from the altar.  7 And he  touched my mouth and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away, and your sin atoned for.”

sections.question: If you were starting a journey, and you were told that one mistake on your journey would lead to your death, and you knew that you were not perfect so you were definitely going to make a mistake, would you go on the journey at all?
Can you become perfect at something without a second or multiple attempts?
If you do not forgive the people who offend you, will they get another chance to do better?
How does forgiving others help them to become perfect?
When a person insults you for no reason at all, do you just stay silent and not mind them, or do you show them an act of love by saying "Thank you!" with a smile?
Who forgives best, the one who does nothing when they are offended, or the one who responds with kindness?
In Matthew 5:39 what did Jesus mean by turning the other cheek?
sections.body: >39 But I tell you, do not resist an evil person. If anyone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to them the other cheek also.

sections.question: Is forgiveness needed in Heaven?
What is the reason for your answer
Is there someone that you have not forgiven?
If yes, then what are you waiting for?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Freedom
1. Draw the picture of a person whose hands have been chained together and is not looking very happy?  
2. When do we chain somebody?  
3. Are you free when your hands have been chained?  
4. What do you have to do if you wish to remove the chains from your hands?
5. How many types of chains do we have?
6. Is the invisible chain in you or outside you?
7. What are some things that put us in invisible chains? 
8. How can the way you think, put you in invisible chains?
9. When you think that there is not enough for everyone, and because of that you always want to have everything to yourself and are worried about losing what you already have, are you free or in chains? 
10. When you think that everyone around you is bad, and you find yourself in trouble but cannot call for help, are you free or in chains? 
11. How can your character put you in invisible chains? 
12. Are you free when you are not humble, and cannot learn from anyone?
13. Are you free when you have an addiction and cannot go a day without spending money or time on it?
14. How can the words from your mouth put you in invisible chains? 
15. Are you free when you speak death, not life, and cannot grow because of it?
16. How can the things you must know, yet do not know, put you in invisible chains?
17. Are you free when you do not know how to take good care of your body and are always falling sick? 
18. How does not knowing God put you in invisible chains?
19. Are you free when you do not fear God, and everything that you do causes your own death?
20. How can a person in invisible chains, die from hunger even though they are surrounded by lots of food?
21. How can a person in invisible chains die from thirst even though there is lots of water where they live?
22. How can a person in invisible chains take 50 years to do something that should have taken them 3 days, and still not be able to finish it?
23. Do you carry your invisible chains with you everywhere you go, even when you are sleeping?
24. Can you use force to break out from your invisible chains?
25. How can you break out of your invisible chains?
26. How can you break another person out of their invisible chains?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Friends

1. Name some of your friends
2. What do you do together when you meet your friends?
3. Why does God give us friends?
4. If friends are not making each other better, is their friendship serving its purpose?
5. In what ways can you make your friend better?
6. When you meet your friend, and your friend is disrespecting their mother, how can you make your friend better?
7. When you meet your friend and your friend is not dressed properly, how do you make your friend better?
8. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends make each other worse every time they meet?
9. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends do not teach each other?
10. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends do not help each other with their work?
11. Is a friendship serving its purpose when friends do not encourage each other when they feel like giving up?
12. Can you make friends when you are not friendly yourself?
13. How do we show God that we appreciate the friends that he has given us?
14. Practice this with your friends: 
	- When going out with your friends, only do what you *all* agree on
	- Avoid doing anything that at least one of you disagrees with
