	- Avoid doing anything that at least one of you disagrees with

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Garments

 1. What is a garment?
 2. Does God cover himself?
 3. What does God cover himself with? Psalm 104:2
 > The LORD wraps himself in light as with a garment; he stretches out the heavens like a tent
 5. If God covers himself, should his children also cover themselves?
 6. How many types of garments does God expect his children to wear?
 7. What are they?
 8. How do you wear your outer garment so that you are not naked?
 9. When you are wearing your outer garment, yet others can see through it, are you covered?
 10. When you bend down to pick something up, will your nakedness be exposed?
 11. When you climb a tree, will your nakedness be exposed?
 12. When you receive good news, and you jump in excitement, will your nakedness be exposed?
 13. What is your inner garment?
 14. What are some things that make up your inner garment?
 15. How do you wear your inner garment?
 16. When you are wearing your outer garment, and yet you are not wearing your inner garment, are you naked?
 17. When you are wearing your inner garment, and yet you are not wearing your outer garment, are you naked?
 18. How many types of garments does God expect his children to wear every day?
 19. Draw yourself, wearing your inner and outer garments.
 20. How does another person know from your picture that you are wearing your inner garment?
 21. Ask God to help you to wear your inner and outer garments.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# God First

 1. You are left in the house alone with your younger brother or sister, to take care of them. Will you want them to inform you before doing anything important, or do you want them to do it before telling you?  
2. What is the reason for your answer?  
3. You and God, who is wiser?  
4. Should you inform God before doing anything important, or should you do it, and later inform God about it?
6. What are some things that you will inform God about, before doing them?

sections.question: What is the reason for your answer?
You and God, who is wiser?
Should you inform God before doing anything important, or should you do it, and later inform God about it?
What are some things that you will inform God about, before doing them?

textLessons.title: God Is Making More of Himself

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# God Is Making More of Himself

 1. Where does God live?
 2. What does God do there?
 3. What do you become when you do all that God teaches you to do? Matthew 5:48
 > 48 Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
 4. Does God know what you are thinking?
 5. How must we think?
 6. Does God hear what you say?
 7. How must we speak?
 8. Does God see what you do?
 9. How must we behave?
 10. How must we dress?
 11. Does God live in other people too?
 12. How must we treat other people?
 13. When you have become like God, and then you become a teacher, who is really the teacher?
 14. When you have become like God, and then you become a doctor, who is really the doctor?
 15. Give your heart to God every day, starting today.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Habits & Courtesy

1. What are habits?  
2. How do your habits shape your character?  
3. How do you know that a habit has become part of you?  
4. Write down 6 habits that you will like to practice every day until they have become part of you.  
5. Remember to do these every day.
6. What is courtesy?  
7. What is the difference between habit and courtesy?
8. Write down 10 of your habits.
9. How can you practice your 10 habits with courtesy?

sections.question: What are habits?
How do your habits shape your character?
How do you know that a habit has become part of you?
Write down 6 habits that you will like to practice every day until they have become part of you.
Remember to do these every day.
What is courtesy?
What is the difference between habit and courtesy?
Write down 10 of your habits.
How can you practice your 10 habits with courtesy?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Holiness

1. Name an object in your home that only your father or mother can use, not everyone else.
2. Is there a cup in your house that only your father and mother can drink from?
3. Is that cup separated unto your father and mother?
4. Is there a bowl in your house that only your father and mother can eat from?
5. Is that bowl separated unto your father and mother?
6. Is there a chair that only your father can use?
7. When do you say that something is Holy?
8. Can an object be Holy?
9. How does an object become Holy?
10. Can the ground be Holy?
11. How does the ground become Holy?
12. Can a person be Holy?
13. How does a person become Holy?
14. Are you Holy when you are not separated unto God? Isaiah 52:11
15. What will happen to the good tomatoes when you put good and rotten tomatoes together in the same basket?
16. If you wish to preserve the good tomatoes, what will you have to do?
17. What do we do with rotten tomatoes?
18. Do you wish to become like rotten tomatoes?
19. What do you have to do not wish to become like rotten tomatoes?
20. What kind of people do you have to separate yourselves from?
21. What are some common things that people do that you don't have to do if you wish to be Holy?
22. Should you join people to do something because everyone is doing it?
23. Is God Holy? 
24. Does God want all his children to be Holy as well? Leviticus 20:26
> You are to be holy to me because I, the LORD, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be my own.
25. Is God common?
26. Does God also want his children to be uncommon?
27. Is God special?
28. Does God also want his children to be special?
29. During creation, whom did God appoint to rule over the day?
30. Whom did God appoint to rule over the night?
31. Does the moon have a light of its own, or the moon only reflects the light of the sun?
32. Does the day and night already have their ruler?
33. What are the two kingdoms of this world?
34. Who rules over the kingdom of light?
35. Does the Kingdom of Light live by a different set of rules, have its own way of dressing, music, movies, speaking, marriage, etc?
36. Describe music in the Kingdom of Light.
37. Describe dressing in the Kingdom of Light.
38. Who rules over the Kingdom of Darkness?
39. Does the Kingdom of Darkness live by a different set of rules, have its own way of dressing, music, movies, speaking, marriage, etc?
40. Describe music in the Kingdom of Darkness.
41. Describe dressing in the Kingdom of Darkness.
42. When you join the Kingdom of Light who is your ruler?
43. How do you join the Kingdom of Light?
44. When you join the Kingdom of Darkness who is your ruler?
45. How do you join the Kingdom of Darkness?
46. Can you belong to both kingdoms at the same time?
47. Who do you wish to be your ruler?
48. Which kingdom do you have to join?
49. Give your heart to God.
50. Why did God instruct Abraham to leave his family? Genesis 12:1
> The Lord said to Abram, “Leave your country, your relatives, and your father's home, and go to a land that I am going to show you.
51. What is the story of Samson?
52. How will you be treated like Samson when you step out of the light into the Kingdom of Darkness? Judges 16:21
> And the Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes and brought him down to Gaza and bound him with bronze shackles. And he ground at the mill in the prison.
53. Will you be bound?
54. Will your strengths and talents be wasted?
55. Will you be harmed in a way that will make it difficult for you to return to the light? 
56. Will the Kingdom of Darkness use you for entertainment? Judges 16:25
> And when their hearts were merry, they said, “Call Samson, that he may entertain us.” So they called Samson out of the prison, and he entertained them. They made him stand between the pillars.
57. Will you be used to mock God and bring dishonor to his name? Judges 16:23
> Now the lords of the Philistines gathered to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god and to rejoice, and they said, “Our god has given Samson our enemy into our hand.”
58. Is it for your safety that God instructs you to separate yourself from the Kingdom of Darkness and walk in the light?
59. Repent from anything you have taken from the Kingdom of Darkness and ask God to take you back.

textLessons.title: I Am a Little Bent Tree

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# I Am a Little Bent Tree

1. Have you planted a tree before?
2. What tree was it?
3. Draw a picture of a little bent tree.
4. When a tree starts to grow, and it becomes bent, how do you make it grow straight?
5. Can the stick make the tree straight when it is itself bent?
6. When the tree is already grown, and it is bent, can you make it straight?
7. When is the best time to make a tree straight?
8. When a little tree has been made straight, will it ever get bent again?
9. Do you know that you are a little bent tree?
10. When you still insult other people, are you straight?
11. When you still disobey your teachers, are you straight?
12. When you hide things from your parents, are you straight?
13. What can go wrong when you hide things from your parents?
14. When is the best time for you to become straight?
15. If you are the little bent tree, then who is the stick that is working to make you straight?
16. Can the people working to make you straight succeed when they themselves are also not straight?
17. Write down 4 ways in which God works to make you straight.
18. Write down 4 ways in which your parents work to make you straight.
19. Write down 4 ways in which your teachers work to make you straight.
20. What will happen to you when you do not allow yourself to be made straight by God, your teachers, parents, etc.?

sections.question: Have you planted a tree before?
What tree was it?
Draw a picture of a little bent tree.
When a tree starts to grow, and it becomes bent, how do you make it grow straight?
Can the stick make the tree straight when it is itself bent?
When the tree is already grown, and it is bent, can you make it straight?
When is the best time to make a tree straight?
When a little tree has been made straight, will it ever get bent again?
Do you know that you are a little bent tree?
When you still insult other people, are you straight?
When you still disobey your teachers, are you straight?
When you hide things from your parents, are you straight?
What can go wrong when you hide things from your parents?
When is the best time for you to become straight?
If you are the little bent tree, then who is the stick that is working to make you straight?
Can the people working to make you straight succeed when they themselves are also not straight?
Write down 4 ways in which God works to make you straight.
Write down 4 ways in which your parents work to make you straight.
Write down 4 ways in which your teachers work to make you straight.
What will happen to you when you do not allow yourself to be made straight by God, your teachers, parents, etc.?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Parents

1. In Luke 10:25-37, what is the parable of the good samaritan?
2. Who is your neighbor?
3. Who is the parent of a child?
4. Is the parent of the child the one who gives birth to the child or the person who treats the child like their own child?
5. If the child looks up to you as a parent, and is willing to do all that you instruct them to, are you the parent of the child or the one who gave birth to them?
6. What are your responsibilities towards the child as their parent?
7. Should you meet the child's physical needs only, or spiritual as well?
8. How do you meet the child's physical needs?
9. How do you meet the child's spiritual needs?
10. If the child's physical needs are not taken care of, like food, clothing, and shelter can you develop the mind of the child?
11. If the child is *always* occupied with physical work, can the child have time to do the things that will help them to develop?
12. How do you protect the child?
13. Should you protect the body of the child only, or their minds as well?
14. In what ways can you protect the mind of a child?
15. Does the child have a mind of their own or do they simply mirror what they see other people do?
16. How do you help the child to form their mind?
17. How can you help the child form their mind about strangers, and how to treat them?
18. How can you help the child form their mind about the purpose of their lives and how to live it?
19. How can you help the child form their mind about dressing up?
20. How can you help the child form their mind about God and who God is to them?
21. When you get tired of talking to the child and answering their questions are you helping them to form their mind?
22. If you do not help the child to form their mind, will they form their mind elsewhere?
23. In what ways can the child form their mind elsewhere?
24. If you are always thinking for the child and making decisions for them, will their mind form properly?
25. Does the child have a will of their own or they are born having their own will?
26. In what ways can you help shape the will of a child?
27. Can you shape the will of a child when you do not allow them to make choices and face the consequences of their choices?
28. If you are always forcing them to do the right thing are you shaping the will of the child?
29. Does the child have a character of their own?
30. How can you help the child form their character?
31. Between which ages is the child easily influenced?
32. Whom should the child spend the most easily influenced period of their life with?
33. Should the child spend this period of their life with a stranger, or with their parents?
34. What does it mean to socialize a person?
35. In what ways can a child be socialized by their parent, the more they spend time with them?
36. Can a parent socialize their child when they are too busy to spend time with them?
37. Can a parent socialize their child successfully if they lose their child's respect?
38. Can a parent speak, dress, or act anyhow and still keep their child's respect?
39. What are some things a parent should not do if they wish to be respected by their child?
40. What are some things a parent should do if they wish to be respected by their child?
41. In what ways can you socialize a child's religion?
42. In what ways can you socialize a child's language?
43. In what ways can you socialize a child's attitude?
44. In what ways can you socialize a child's traditions?
45. Should you complete the child's socialization before handing them over to the society whose socialization may not always be in agreement with yours?
46. What is formed between the parent and the child the more they spend time together?
47. What is the importance of the bond that is formed between a parent and a child?
48. Can the parent instruct the child and they will obey even when they are much older than the age that they are easily influenced, because of the bond that they share together?
49. Can the child decide one day that their parent is no longer their parent, and begin to treat them like a stranger when they share a bond?
50. Does this bond help the child to follow the right path and not do anything that will disappoint their parents?
51. Is it better for the child to form this bond with a stranger or another person who they do not live with, or with their parents who they live with?
52. What could go wrong if the child forms a bond with a stranger whom they do not live with, rather than their parents who they spend most of their time with?
53. Who is the most influential person in the life of the child?
54. Who is responsible for how a child will turn out in life?
55. Who is your first Pastor?
56. Who is your first Teacher?
57. Who is your first Priest?
58. Who is your first Prophet?
59. Who is your first role model?

sections.question: In Luke 10:25-37, what is the parable of the good samaritan?
Who is your neighbor?
Who is the parent of a child?
Is the parent of the child the one who gives birth to the child or the person who treats the child like their own child?
If the child looks up to you as a parent, and is willing to do all that you instruct them to, are you the parent of the child or the one who gave birth to them?
What are your responsibilities towards the child as their parent?
Should you meet the child's physical needs only, or spiritual as well?
How do you meet the child's physical needs?
How do you meet the child's spiritual needs?
If the child's physical needs are not taken care of, like food, clothing, and shelter can you develop the mind of the child?
If the child is *always* occupied with physical work, can the child have time to do the things that will help them to develop?
How do you protect the child?
Should you protect the body of the child only, or their minds as well?
In what ways can you protect the mind of a child?
Does the child have a mind of their own or do they simply mirror what they see other people do?
How do you help the child to form their mind?
How can you help the child form their mind about strangers, and how to treat them?
How can you help the child form their mind about the purpose of their lives and how to live it?
How can you help the child form their mind about dressing up?
How can you help the child form their mind about God and who God is to them?
When you get tired of talking to the child and answering their questions are you helping them to form their mind?
If you do not help the child to form their mind, will they form their mind elsewhere?
In what ways can the child form their mind elsewhere?
If you are always thinking for the child and making decisions for them, will their mind form properly?
Does the child have a will of their own or they are born having their own will?
In what ways can you help shape the will of a child?
Can you shape the will of a child when you do not allow them to make choices and face the consequences of their choices?
If you are always forcing them to do the right thing are you shaping the will of the child?
Does the child have a character of their own?
How can you help the child form their character?
Between which ages is the child easily influenced?
Whom should the child spend the most easily influenced period of their life with?
Should the child spend this period of their life with a stranger, or with their parents?
What does it mean to socialize a person?
In what ways can a child be socialized by their parent, the more they spend time with them?
Can a parent socialize their child when they are too busy to spend time with them?
Can a parent socialize their child successfully if they lose their child's respect?
Can a parent speak, dress, or act anyhow and still keep their child's respect?
What are some things a parent should not do if they wish to be respected by their child?
What are some things a parent should do if they wish to be respected by their child?
In what ways can you socialize a child's religion?
In what ways can you socialize a child's language?
In what ways can you socialize a child's attitude?
In what ways can you socialize a child's traditions?
Should you complete the child's socialization before handing them over to the society whose socialization may not always be in agreement with yours?
What is formed between the parent and the child the more they spend time together?
What is the importance of the bond that is formed between a parent and a child?
Can the parent instruct the child and they will obey even when they are much older than the age that they are easily influenced, because of the bond that they share together?
Can the child decide one day that their parent is no longer their parent, and begin to treat them like a stranger when they share a bond?
Does this bond help the child to follow the right path and not do anything that will disappoint their parents?
Is it better for the child to form this bond with a stranger or another person who they do not live with, or with their parents who they live with?
What could go wrong if the child forms a bond with a stranger whom they do not live with, rather than their parents who they spend most of their time with?
Who is the most influential person in the life of the child?
Who is responsible for how a child will turn out in life?
Who is your first Pastor?
Who is your first Teacher?
Who is your first Priest?
Who is your first Prophet?
Who is your first role model?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Popular but Not Correct

1. What are some things that are popular but God does not approve of them, or consider them to be right?  
2. Write down 10 things that are popular or common around you, but are not correct
3. How does God correct the things that are popular, but not correct?
4. How does God correct the things that are popular, but not correct, through children?  
5. What were some things that were popular in the time of Abraham, but God did not approve of them? Joshua 24:2
> 2 Joshua said to all the people, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Long ago your ancestors, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived beyond the Euphrates River and worshiped other gods.
6. How did God plan to renew the earth through Abrahams's children?
7. As a child, should you learn only the good and beautiful, only the ugly, or both?
8. What will God do when you refuse to learn everything that God teaches you as a child?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Rest In God

1. When do you say that a person is resting?
2. Are you resting when you are sitting down and doing nothing, but in your mind, you are worried about where your next food will come from?
3. Are you resting when you are too busy to do the things that will help you to grow?
4. Does God bring a child into the world without knowing what to do with the child?
5. Does God bring a child into the world before planning what to do with the child?
6. Does God plan your life before bringing you into the world?
7. When you come into the world, and you decide to live by your own plan, are you resting in God?
8. When you make every decision all by yourself, without God, are you resting in God?
9. When you choose your next school without God are you resting in God?
10. When you choose your next job without God are you resting in God? 
11. What can go wrong when you live by your plan and not God's?
12. Can you see the end of the choices that you make, from the beginning? 
13. When do you say that a person is resting in God?
14. Will your life be like every other person's when you choose to rest in God?
15. Will you be anxious about every single thing in life when you choose to rest in God?
16. Will you be flexible and accept whatever God gives you when you choose to rest in God?
17. Will you always be in a hurry when you choose to rest in God?
18. When you rest in God, will God be able to achieve his purpose for your life?
19. Do you choose to rest in God?
20. When you are alone with God, pray and let him know the choice you have made

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Rest

Rest is anything that you do that takes your mind off work. This could be in the form of spending time with your family to just talk, take a walk, or read a book. Resting when you have not done any work is no longer rest, but rather, decay.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Stages of a Man

1. How many stages must every Man go through in their lifetime?
2. What are the stages?
3. How do they behave when they are in the **Animal** stage?
4. Are they selfish?
5. Do they have animal fear?
6. Are they happy when others fail?
7. Do they practice good hygiene?
8. Do they care if they are naked?
9. How do they dress?
10. Are they polite?
11. Are they able to control themselves?
12. Do they settle disagreements with force or with reason and wise words?
13. Do they value spiritual things like the Word of God?
14. In Matthew 7:6, hwo are the dogs and pigs, and what will they do when given the Word of God?
> “Do not give dogs what is sacred; do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they may trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.
15. How do you remove the animal from them?
16. If the animal is not removed from them, and they grow up, what will they become?
17. When the animal is taken out of them what do they become?
18. Is everyone that you come across, human?
19. What is the reason for your answer?
20. How do they behave when they reach the **Human** stage?
21. How do they dress?
22. How do they speak?
23. Do they treat others like they treat themselves?
24. Are they selfish?
25. Do they practice good hygiene?
26. Do they have animal fear?
27. Do they forgive?
28. Are they polite?
29. Are they able to control themselves?
30. Do they settle disagreements with force or with reason and wise words?
31. Do they feel the pain of others, and try to offer a helping hand?
32. Do they value spiritual things like Prayer and worship?
33. Are they perfect?
34. How do they become perfect, like God?
35. How do they behave when they reach the **God** stage?
36. Are they selfish?
37. How do they think?
38. How do they speak?
39. Do they speak the truth?
40. Do they enjoy the pain of others?
41. Are they perfect?
42. Which stage are you now, and why?
43. How will you get to the next stage?
44. In Matthew 15:21-26, who is the dog?
> 21 Jesus left that place and went off to the territory near the cities of Tyre and Sidon. 22 A Canaanite woman who lived in that region came to him. “Son of David!” she cried out. “Have mercy on me, sir! My daughter has a demon and is in a terrible condition.”
> 
> 23 But Jesus did not say a word to her. His disciples came to him and begged him, “Send her away! She is following us and making all this noise!”
> 
> 24 Then Jesus replied, “I have been sent only to the lost sheep of the people of Israel.”
> 
> 25 At this the woman came and fell at his feet. “Help me, sir!” she said.
> 
> 26 Jesus answered, “It isn't right to take the children's food and throw it to the dogs.”
45. Write down 5 things you may have to *stop* doing to become human.
46. Write down 5 things you may have to *start* doing to become human.
47. Write down one thing you may have to start doing to become like God.

Write down 5 things you may have to *start* doing to become human.

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Starting to believe

You start by going into your closet and speaking the sincere intent of your heart to God in prayer. Guess what, he lives in you and hears everything you say. You confess your sins to him and ask for forgiveness. You then surrender yourself to him. Yes, the Christian life begins with acknowledging that God knows what is best for you and totally surrendering your heart, mind, body, and soul to him. Tell him "Heavenly Father, I give you my heart, I give you my mind, I give you my body and soul in Jesus' name." God uses your heart to guide you. Each day that you wake up you must consecrate yourself unto God by surrendering yourself to him. As you continue to follow the leading of his spirit he will begin his work of perfecting you.

You can later find a church to fellowship with. 

Your quiet time with God is also very important in your walk with God. Each morning you wake up earlier than you usually do, and do a few things:

-  Sing a worship song. Singing worship songs have a way of transforming you from the inside, making you spiritually sensitive and also feel the presence of God in you.
    
-  You say a prayer
    
-  Read a portion of scripture. I recommend that you start with the gospels (Matthew, Mark, Luke, John) before saying Proverbs, Psalms, and the others.
    
-  Meditate on what you have read and think about ways in which you can apply it. For instance, if Christ said that we shall be judged by every single word that we speak, I will start by repenting from every foul word I have ever spoken and be determined to speak only good words going forward.
    

God is not concerned by where you are now or where you have been, only where you wish to be. He knows how to get you to your destination, so don't let your past sins weigh you down.

Matthew 5: 48 is your watch-verse.

parts.markdown:
# The Gifts of the Earth

1. What are some of the gifts of the earth?
2. What are some of the gifts of the Heavens?
3. How do you receive gifts from Heaven?
4. What gifts of the earth do wish to start exchanging with other people?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Path of the Unrighteous
1. Repeat three times: The path of the unrighteous is hard
2. Who is an unrighteous person?
3. When you choose to live a life of unrighteousness:
	- Will your father support you?
	- Will your mother support you?
	- Will God support you?
	- Will the angels support you?
	- Will your path in life be easy or hard?
4. Who is a righteous person?
5. When you choose to live a life of righteousness:
	- Will your father support you?
	- Will your mother support you?
	- Will God support you?
	- Will the angels support you?
	- Will your path in life be easy or hard?
6. Do you want to live a life of righteousness or unrighteousness?
7. What righteous thing do you want to start doing today?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Promised Land
1. What do you remember from the story of Moses, the children of Israel, and the promised land?
2. In Exodus 3:8, what did Moses tell the children of Israel about the promised land?
> 8 So I have come down to rescue them from the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that land into a good and spacious land, a land flowing with milk and honey—the home of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.
3. Have you seen a piece of land that is flowing with milk and honey?
4. Will arriving at a specific location make your life better?
5. What did Moses teach the children of Israel every day, on their way to the promised land?
6. Did the children of Israel complain?
7. What did they complain about?
8. Did they learn the lessons that Moses taught them?
9. Did they obey God's instructions?
10. What is the nearest city around you?
11. If you were traveling by foot to the nearest city, how long will it take you to arrive?
12. How long did the children of Israel travel in the wilderness?
13. Did they make it to the promised land? Joshua 5:6
>  For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness till all the people who were men of war, who came out of Egypt, were consumed because they obeyed not the voice of the Lord. Unto these the Lord swore that He would not show them the land which the Lord swore unto their fathers that He would give us, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
14. If you were alone in the house with plenty of foodstuffs but no food, and you were feeling hungry but did not know how to cook, will you starve or not?
15. Will you starve because there is no foodstuff in the house?
16. Why will you starve?
17. Is the promised land a physical location?
18. Is the promised land in you or outside you?
19. If the promised land is in you, who are the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites?
20. Can your legs take you to the promised land?
21. What will happen to you when you try to go to the promised land on foot?
22. How do you arrive at the promised land?
23. How did Moses intend to take the children of Israel to the promised land?
24. Why did the children of Israel fail to make it to the promised land?
25. Can you reach the promised land without changing the way you think?
26. Can you reach the promised land without changing your attitude?
27. Does God want to give you himself, or all the food in the world?
28. Does God want to give you himself, or all the lands of the world?
29. If you do not *think* like God, are you at the promised land?
30. If you do not *speak* like God are you at the promised land?
31. If you do not *act* like God, are you at the promised land?
32. How will you know when you have arrived at the promised land?
33. Will you lack when you reach the promised land?
34. Will you make the wrong choices when you reach the promised land?
35. When you have reached the promised land, will you succeed no matter where you find yourself?
36. When you do not allow God to take you to the promised land, in what ways can a task that should take you a day, take you 40 years, and you will still not be able to complete it?
37. Are you at the promised land?
38. How will you get to the promised land?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# The Purpose of Childhood

 1. Why do humans come into the world, not as adults, but as little children?  
2. Write down 5 things that you are learning now as a child, that you think will help you when you grow up?

sections.question: Write down 5 things that you are learning now as a child, that you think will help you when you grow up?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Time

 1. How old is the sun?  
2. How old are you?  
3. What is the longest that you think you will ever live?  
4. Subtract that from the age of the sun?  
5. Do you see that you time on earth, compared to the sun is like a blink of an eye?  
6. What is a blink of an eye?  
7. How then should you spend your blink of an eye on earth? Should you spend it doing useful things?  
8. What is the best way to spend your blink of an eye on earth?
9. If you had a car, and you were given only one gallon of fuel, will you decide where you are going, before you start your journey, or you will start your journey before deciding where you are going?  
10. Draw the picture of a winding path with many branches, that finally ends with God? 
11. If you have a fixed amount of time, can you choose to branch to other paths (gossip, stealing, insult) which do not lead to your destination, before finally making your way to God?  
12. Is your time not running out as you try other branches that do not lead to God?
13. Have you decided what you wish to do with your blink of an eye on earth?
14. Speak to God about it and ask him to help you arrive at your destination.

textLessons.title: Treasures in a Jar of Clay

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# Treasures in a Jar of Clay

1. What is something that belongs to you?
2. When do you say that something belongs to you?
3. Can what belongs to you, be taken away from you?
4. Can you defend what belongs to you, against *anyone* who will try to take it away from you?
5. Does it belong to you, forever?
6. If what belongs to you, does not belong to you forever, and a person who was stronger than you could take it away from you, does it *truly* belong to you?
7. What are some things that belong to you that can be taken away from you, and do not belong to you forever?
8. What are some things that belong to you forever, and cannot be taken away from you, even if the person was stronger and more powerful than you?
9. In Luke 10:38-42, what is the story of Jesus, Mary, and Martha?
>38 As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.  39 She had a sister called Mary,  who sat at the Lord’s feet listening to what he said.  40 But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!”
>41 “Martha, Martha,”  the Lord answered,  “you are worried and upset about many things,  42 but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.”
10. In Luke 10:42, what was the reason for Christ's answer to Martha?
> ...but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.
11. When do you say that something truly belongs to you?
12. Can your knowledge of God be taken away from you?
13. Can your valuable memories be taken away from you?
14. Can the content of your Character which is Godlike be taken away from you?
15. Can your Godlike personality be taken away from you?
16. Which is more important, the things that belong to you that can be taken away from you, or the things that belong to you that *cannot* be taken away from you?
17. Do you keep the things that cannot be taken away from you, in you, or outside you?
18. Are the things that cannot be taken away from you, visible or invisible?
19. Which is more important, the things that belong to you that cannot be seen, or the things that belong to you that can be seen?
20. Which is more important, the things that belong to you that are in you, or the things that belong to you that are outside you?
21. Who protects the treasures in you from the people that will try to take them away from you?
22. What is a treasure?
23. What are some things that people treasure in this world? 
24. Can these treasures be taken away from them or not?
25. Which kind of treasures should you spend every day of your life finding and collecting?
26. If your treasures are the contents of your mind which have eternal value, the Godly content of your heart, then what is the jar of clay?
28. Which treasures do you wish to collect into your jar of clay?
29. How do you collect treasures into your jar of clay?
30. In Luke 12:15, if your life is not measured by how much you own, then what is your life measured by?
> Beware! Guard against every kind of greed. Life is not measured by how much you own.
31. Can you be rich yet poor?
32. How can you be rich yet poor?
33. Can you be clothed, yet naked?
34. How can you be clothed, yet naked?
35. Can you be healthy, yet sick?
36. How can you be healthy, yet sick?
37. What will God do when your jar of clay is full of good treasures?

sections.question: What is something that belongs to you?
When do you say that something belongs to you?
Can what belongs to you, be taken away from you?
Can you defend what belongs to you, against *anyone* who will try to take it away from you?
Does it belong to you, forever?
If what belongs to you, does not belong to you forever, and a person who was stronger than you could take it away from you, does it *truly* belong to you?
What are some things that belong to you that can be taken away from you, and do not belong to you forever?
What are some things that belong to you forever, and cannot be taken away from you, even if the person was stronger and more powerful than you?
In Luke 10:38-42, what is the story of Jesus, Mary, and Martha?
sections.body:
>38 As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.  39 She had a sister called Mary,  who sat at the Lord’s feet listening to what he said.  40 But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!”
>41 “Martha, Martha,”  the Lord answered,  “you are worried and upset about many things,  42 but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.”

sections.question: In Luke 10:42, what was the reason for Christ's answer to Martha?
sections.body: > ...but few things are needed—or indeed only one. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.

sections.question: When do you say that something truly belongs to you?
Can your knowledge of God be taken away from you?
Can your valuable memories be taken away from you?
Can the content of your Character which is Godlike be taken away from you?
Can your Godlike personality be taken away from you?
Which is more important, the things that belong to you that can be taken away from you, or the things that belong to you that *cannot* be taken away from you?
Do you keep the things that cannot be taken away from you, in you, or outside you?
Are the things that cannot be taken away from you, visible or invisible?
Which is more important, the things that belong to you that cannot be seen, or the things that belong to you that can be seen?
Which is more important, the things that belong to you that are in you, or the things that belong to you that are outside you?
Who protects the treasures in you from the people that will try to take them away from you?
What is a treasure?
What are some things that people treasure in this world?
Can these treasures be taken away from them or not?
Which kind of treasures should you spend every day of your life finding and collecting?
If your treasures are the contents of your mind which have eternal value, the Godly content of your heart, then what is the jar of clay?
Which treasures do you wish to collect into your jar of clay?
How do you collect treasures into your jar of clay?
In Luke 12:15, if your life is not measured by how much you own, then what is your life measured by?
sections.body: > Beware! Guard against every kind of greed. Life is not measured by how much you own.

sections.question: Can you be rich yet poor?
How can you be rich yet poor?
Can you be clothed, yet naked?
How can you be clothed, yet naked?
Can you be healthy, yet sick?
How can you be healthy, yet sick?
What will God do when your jar of clay is full of good treasures?

parts.title: I
parts.markdown:
# You are a Nation

1. What nations do you know of?
2. How many people usually live in a nation?
3. Do you know that you are a nation?  
4. How many friends do you have?  
5. Do you know that your friends also have friends?  
6. Do you know that there are also people around you who learn from you without letting you know about it?  
7. (Draw a picture of a tree of people learning from you, directly and indirectly, using only two people at a time)  
8. Based on the tree which you have drawn, how many people do you really need to change an entire nation?
9. When you teach one person, how many people are you really teaching?
10. What is the reason for your answer? 
11. When you hear gossip, and you share the gossip with another person, how many people are you really sharing the gossip with?
12. What is the reason for your answer? 
13. When you show kindness to one person, how many people are you really showing kindness to?
14. What is the reason for your answer?
15. When you make one person angry, how many people are you really making angry?
16. What is the reason for your answer?
17. How should you conduct yourself before others, now that you know that you are a nation?
18. What is the reason for your answer?
19. What can you say to another nation when you meet them, that will benefit the people of that nation?  
20. What can you teach another nation when you meet them, that will benefit the people of that nation?  
21. Why did God say that Abraham would be the father of many nations even though he had no children?  
22. Draw the flag of your nation
23. Would anybody like to visit your nation?
24. Activity: Demonstrate how the nations of the world came to practice greetings.
